choices: N/A
Thanksgiving
Easter
Christmas
Something else
0.content: It turns out that Vampyre Lane doesn't just come in Halloween. It'll now show up in the world at different holidays. The theme for the lane will change depending on the day. Now, what time is it when Vampyre Lane returns?
0.title: Vampyre Lane Returns

choices: Seth
Megan
Jacob
Donna
Skip to Thanksgiving Dinner
02.content:
All are welcome to the Vampyre Park Turkey Day Festival, offering fun for the whole family, complimentary catering from some of the best chefs in the multiverse, and an awe-inspiring reenactment of the very first thanksgiving...

“Honestly, I’d rather be eating at ma’s,” the man in the passenger's seat commented, as he thumbed idly through the tiny flyer. He had his legs kicked up on the dashboard as the dumpy van drove slowly through the woods. He wore a black Metallica t-shirt beneath an unzipped brown jacket, complete with dark blue jeans. “I mean, ‘turkey day’? Who even says that anymore?”

“Yeah, well she’s in Virginia this month, and I don’t feel like cooking. Do you have any better ideas, Seth?” The woman driving rolled her eyes, tired of her husband nitpicking the flyer throughout the entire drive. She wore a black scarf atop a beige duster coat, over black skinny pants. “Besides, it’s 20 bucks per ticket, and they’ve got some kind of five-star caterer lined up. There’s even some kind of play going on, I think.”

“Do you really believe all that, Megan?” Seth laughed, gesturing to the seemingly never-ending forest stretching from horizon to horizon. “We’re in the middle of nowhere! This ‘vampyre lane’ isn’t even on any maps!”

“It’s some rich gated community. They probably want their privacy,” the woman chuckled. “We should be happy they’re letting us proles stink up their fancy neighborhood.”

Megan tried to focus on navigating the strange, bumpy, winding road, but it was difficult with all the distractions coming from the back seat. “C’mon! Give it!” Their daughter whined loudly in the backseat, twisting her seatbelt to her limit as she reached over to the other side of the seat, trying to pry the console from her older brother’s hands. “It’s my turn! You’ve been playing for the whole drive!”

“Hey! No! Just one more level!” The boy complained, trying to shake her off his back. “Get off!”

Eventually, he overpowered her, forcing her back to the other side of the car. Annoyed, she crossed her arms and pouted. She wasn’t even interested in the game itself at this point; it was a matter of principle. “Mooom, Jacob won’t let me play!” She complained loudly, in the most annoying voice she could muster.

“Ugh. Jacob, just let Donna have a turn,” Megan groaned, furrowing her brow as she rubbed her forehead with a hand. These kids were giving her a headache…

“Ugh, fiiine, whatever,” Jacob groaned in frustration, saving his progress before handing it over to his annoyingly smug sister. “Just don’t mess up my save file.”

“No promises,” Donna taunted as she started playing. As the drive continued, the entire family slowly grew more and more confused by the sheer stretch of forest they seemed to be travelling through. They seemed to keep crossing by the same landmarks, as if they were traveling in circles, although the path consisted of a single, uninterrupted stretch of road. Worse still, the annoying bumpiness of the road was starting to become nauseating, and eventually it felt like they couldn’t take it anymore. This ‘Vampyre Lane’ was supposed to be just a few miles from their house, and yet it seemed like they’d been driving forever. Eventually, though, the fabled Vampyre Lane came into view.

“There, see? This doesn’t look so bad, does it?” Megan smiled in relief as she drove right into the neighborhood, the huge front gates hanging wide open. Compared to the wild and untamed forest outside, the neighborhood was incredibly clean and well-kept, with beautifully maintained lawns and huge, gorgeous mansions as far as the eye could see. Even the kids seemed impressed, pausing their bickering for a moment to gawk at the houses as they passed by. As they drove, though, the car passed by a woman raking the leaves off her porch. The catch was, the woman seemed to be dressed in some sort of huge, hyper-realistic wolf costume!

“Whoa, hey! What was she wearing!?” Jacob said, turning to the back window as he tried to get a look at the costumed local. “Go back! Go back!”

“Was that some sort of wolf costume?” Donna asked.

“You were probably just seeing things,” Seth said, unable to tell whether the kids were just messing with them or not. The car was silent for a few moments as the two siblings stared attentively out at the neighborhood… until one of them saw something!

“Look! Over there! There’s another one!” Donna yelled, eagerly pointing at a window to a woman mowing her lawn while seemingly dressed in a giant squirrel costume. The two practically pressed themselves against the window, staring at the squirrel lady as they passed by.

“Oh no...” Jacob gasped. “Did we just drive into a neighborhood full of a buncha furries?”

“They’re probably just dressed up for thanksgiving or something,” Seth offered.

“What do wolves and squirrels have to do with thanksgiving?”

“I don’t know. What’s the alternative? That they just dress in those huge costumes 24/7, 365 days a year?”

“Maybe!” Jacob insisted. “Maybe they’re weird furry cultists that lured us here to sacrifice us to their furry gods!” His little sister clasped her hand over her mouth, horrified by the possibility. His parents just rolled their eyes.

“Alright, now you’re just being ridiculous,” Megan said, seeing the park approaching in the distance. “Now, Vampyre Park’s right up ahead. Please don’t get us kicked out, okay? This is our one shot at a nice thanksgiving.”

“No promises!” Jacob repeated, as they drove into the parking lot near the park. ‘Vampyre Park’ was huge, and resembled an exotic garden more than a regular park, with beautiful rivers and ponds travelling through between its perimeters. Dozens of people were wandering the park, chowing down on delicious food and listening to the bands playing in the distance. They notably didn’t see any more people in animal costumes, to their relief. Everyone at the festival seemed pretty normal, or at least they seemed normal from the perspective of the family just getting out of their car.

Every member of the family seemed to be interested in a different part of the festival. Seth wanted to check out that beautiful, revolution-era mansion in the distance; Megan wanted to try some of this cuisine she’s heard so much about; Jacob wanted to investigate those few weirdos with their strange animal ‘costumes’; and Donna wanted to head to the stage and see the performances. They all recognized this immediately; this certainly wasn’t the first time the family had to split up at an event. “Alright, well, dinner won’t be in a couple hours, so we can meet up at the hill there then,” Seth said, wrapping some weird, Vampyre Park armbands around Donna and Jacob’s arms. He didn’t know what they were for, but according to the flyer, if anybody was caught without them, the consequences would be ‘severe’. “Until then, you have fun. Try not to spoil your appetite, and don’t lose your armbands.”

With that, the four excitedly split up, excited to check out the most interesting parts of the festival. Which character should we follow until the Thanksgiving Dinner proper rolls around?
02.title: Turkey Day

choices: Sprint as fast as you can!
Conserve your energy and keep jogging
Forget the run - hide in the bushes!
023.content:
You are Jacob, and you thought this thanksgiving would be just as boring as all the others. You were never a big eater, and having to hang around a bunch of boring grown-ups all day was always miserable. You thought this festival would be just as lame… but now, it seemed things might get a little interesting. After all, now you had a real, genuine mystery to solve! You had seen a few people in huge, hyper realistic animal costumes while being driven through the neighborhood, and you got the feeling those weren’t the only one. What kind of dark secrets were being hidden in Vampyre Lane, you wondered? The possibilities were endless!

While the rest of your family wandered off, you started asking around the festival, but you ran into a problem immediately; nobody at the park seemed to be a local, and all the other visitors were just as clueless as you were. Eventually, though, you learned that one of the ‘animal’ people was actually hosting the entire festival! It was all you could do to not go rubbing your hands together in devious excitement; this was exactly the lead you’d been wanting! Perhaps this entire festival is part of the Vampyre Lane conspiracy! Apparently, her name was ‘Katie’, and she was dressed as a giant turkey for thanksgiving. Most people just thought she was the mascot or something, and thought her costume was completely innocent… but you saw through the lies!

She wasn’t that hard to find. She was about eight feet tall, utterly towering over the rest of the crowd. She was almost twice your size, in fact, which made you slightly nervous. Not only was she tall, but she was ‘thick’ too, for lack of a better world. Perhaps ‘pudgy’; she definitely had a prominent pear shape, with her hips being much wider than her shoulders. Most of her weight went to her rear and to her belly; her huge rump and round paunch were both clearly visible even through her big, flowing old-fashioned dress, and both looked like they could crush you easily. She seemed to be in a bit of a rush, but you wanted to interrogate her before she could get away. “Hey, uh, lady?” You said, tugging on her dress.

You were stunned by just how detailed and realistic her ‘costume’ was. She could actually control her beak, which was made evident when she smiled at you. The huge, curvy woman leaned over, until she was about eye-level with you. “Oh, well hello there, little one! Did you want your picture taken with me?” She said, in a big, booming, but friendly voice.

“What? No,” you shake your head. “Could you tell me what’s up with the costume?”

“What? Oh, this is the kind of outfit the early pilgrims might’ve worn during the very first thanksgiving!” She smiled, gesturing to her dress.

“No, I mean why are you a turkey?” You replied, deadpan. She stared at you for a few seconds, uncomprehending, before she snapped her fingers in realization.

“Ah, you’re wondering why I’m not part of the thanksgiving feast!” She incorrectly realized. Before you could correct her, she stood up and continued. “Well, about 15 years back, back when I was just a normal turkey, I was pardoned by the president himself!” She explained, as if she’d rehearsed this whole speech before. “I thought for sure I would be somebody’s thanksgiving dinner… but out of all the turkeys in the world, he chose me!” She almost swooned at the memory. “I was so thankful, I decided to dedicate myself to spreading the spirit of thanksgiving… and Vampyre Lane seemed like the best place to start!”

Well, this lady is absolutely insane, you thought to yourself. Before you could ask any further questions, though, the turkey just reached down and playfully ruffled your hair. “I hope that answered your questions, little one. Now, I have to get to the turkey run!” By the time you fixed your hair, she was already walking away, her huge hips swaying as she walked.

“Wait! What’s a turkey run?” You cried out after her, but your voice was drowned out by the chatter of the crowd, and the huge woman walked much faster than you could even run. You clenched your fist as you watched her disappear into the distance. “Damn…” You had successfully confirmed that the owner was completely insane, and might even think she was a real turkey… but you hadn’t figured out why, or to what end. Though she had gotten away, your resolve was stronger than ever, and you knew you needed to find out what this ‘turkey run’ was. You could only think of one place to figure that out, though…

“Dad! Dad! Helloooo!” You cry out as you wander around the festival, in the general direction you thought you saw Seth walking. You eventually find him chowing down on a freshly cooked hot dog at one of the stalls. “Dad!” You yell, running up to him, eager to figure this out before the ‘turkey run’ started.

“Hmm?” He raised a brow, turning to you half-attentively.

“Do you still have that flyer?” You ask, eagerly.

“Uh, I think,” he said, digging through his pockets.

“Could you give it to me, maybe?” You insist.

Eventually, he finally finds the flyer, pulling it from his jeans pocket. “Sure. Knock yourself out,” he said, before turning back to his meal. You skim through the flyer as fast as you could, looking through all the events planned, until you finally come across this;

THE TURKEY RUN
Starting Point: Amphitheater at 3:20 p.m.
Stay in the shape by jogging this exciting circuit through the Therian Forest! Don’t fall behind, or you may get gobbled up by the thanksgiving turkey! A decent level of fitness is recommended. Special prizes offered.


You were filled with panic. That was in 5 minutes, and the amphitheater was all the way on the other side of the park! You were so anxious over this that you completely ignored the part about getting ‘gobbled up’, too preoccupied with sprinting to the amphitheater as fast as you could. You arrive just as the director of the ‘race’ was making their announcements and explaining the rules. Once again, you ignored the rules completely, trying to squeeze into the crowd and grab one of the empty spots in the race. Finally, you get settled, doing your best to fit in with the other racers. There was only about a dozen people in the ‘turkey run’, you included. Up on the stage, the turkey was looking over the runners with a hungry look on her face.

“Once again, the trail is about one mile long, and runners will be given a 1-minute head start before I start comin after ya!” You hear, arriving just as the announcements were wrapping up. You realize you really had no experience running. “Make it to the end without getting gobbled, and you will be given special prizes you can’t get from anywhere but Vampyre Lane! Everyone understand the rules? You’re all ready?” Wait… gobbled? What does that mean? Before you can ask, you hear what sounds like a bell going off. “Go, go, go!” The turkey declares, and everybody immediately starts jogging down a trail, deep into the darkness of the woods. You nervously follow along with them, although you really had no idea what you were doing.

The first tenth of the run was largely uneventful. Just a big group of people jogging at a surprising pace down a big hiking trail. All you could hear was the sounds of birds chirping, and your own, belabored breath. You were already getting pretty tired, and the run hadn’t even really started yet. You couldn’t keep up with the other runners, which made you slightly concerned, too. Was the turkey really going to be chasing you? What would happen if she caught you? That thought kept you running, despite your exhaustion, but you knew you couldn’t keep it through the whole stretch. You had to come up with a plan...
023.title: Running of the Turkeys

choices: Tell one of your family members about what happened
Try to follow the turkey and get a better explanation
0231.content:
You had barely even started, and you could already tell you were dreadfully unprepared for this ‘race’. Just keeping pace with the rest of the runners was sapping you of all your energy quickly; you didn’t know how you could possibly outrun any of them. Maybe… maybe if you started spriting, you’d give yourself a head start before you ran out of energy? That could work! You were going to run out of energy either way, so it’s not like it could hurt. With that thought, you start pushing yourself to run as fast as you possibly can.

It seemed to work at first. You passed every other runner, eventually running ahead of the pack. It didn’t even feel that bad, at first… until you finally started to feel the exhaustion. And when it kicked in, it kicked in hard. You felt like there was this intense pressure bearing down your heart and lungs, to the point you could barely breathe. Blood rushed to your head as you tried to push yourself to keep moving, but eventually, you just didn’t have the strength to continue. The group of runners parted around you as you collapsed, leaning against a nearby tree as you tried to catch your breath.

Your vision was blurry and your heart was beating in your chest. You tried to rest your eyes for a few moments as you recuperated… only to hear incredibly loud footsteps from further down the path. You open your eyes, and can vaguely see, in the distance, the turkey lady from before barreling down the trail, her large body allowing her to chase after the runners at an incredible speed. Even more notably, she seemed to be completely naked now that she was away from the prying eyes of the festival, her body jiggling as she ran.

You stared in disbelief, almost failing to even comprehend the sight. Eventually, your instincts kicked in when you realized the turkey was heading right in your direction. Despite your exhaustion, you got up and started running again; there was a quarter mile distance between you two, so she could never catch up, right? Wrong! She could move at almost three times your speed, allowing her to easily catch up to the runners… and since you were the further behind the other runners, you were the first one to get grabbed.

“Gotchya!” She laughed, as you felt her talon-like hands wrap around your sides and scoop you off your feet. As she held you in the air in front of her, she teased you with a good view into her huge beak and cavernous throat. You were finally struck with the realization; she definitely wasn’t just wearing a costume! This ‘Katie’ was an actual giant, humanoid turkey woman, and now she was about ready to ‘gobble’ you up.

“Aaah!” You cry out as you wriggled futilely against her powerful grasp. “No!” Your heart skipped a beat as you watched that mouth of her suddenly lurch forward, as your head was shoved into her huge beak, your face pressed up against her tongue. “Mph!” At this point, you braced for oblivion, certain that she would ‘bite’ your head of any second now; however, to your surprise, she instead took a big gulp, accepting your head into her throat. In a moment of pure terror, you realized what that flyer meant by ‘gobbled up’; the giant turkey woman was going to swallow you whole!

Your arms were restrained against your sides, but you definitely start kicking at the air with all your might, hoping you’d be able to land a kick and she’d cough you up in surprise. However, you have no such luck; instead, the turkey just leans her head back, lifting your body up in the air. Her throat was now a vertical tube beneath you, meaning even gravity was helping her send you into her belly. She gulped more of you inside with a loud gluck… and then another… and then another. Before you knew it, her tight throat was wrapped around your upper body, only your legs remaining dangling from her beak.

It wasn’t long before your head was pressed through a tight sphincter, which squeezed around every inch of your body as she slid you into her stomach. Eventually, you unceremoniously fell into her belly completely, not even making a bulge in her huge, round, feathery gut. “Mm! You were just delicious!” She smiled, patting her belly as she finished gulping down her first meal for thanksgiving. She was giving the other runners a head start by stopping to taunt you, of course, but she could catch up easily.

Meanwhile, you were slowly starting to cry. You knew roughly what happens to food inside somebody’s belly, and you wanted to have nothing to do with it. “P-please… don’t do this…” You begged, the misery evident in your voice. “I don’t want to… to…”

“What are you talking about?” She asked, sounding genuinely confused. “You know I won’t digest you, right, sweetheart?”

“W-what?” You said, blinking. “Really?”

“Of course not! The ‘turkey run’ is just a game! I’ll let you out once it’s over,” she laughed, and you felt a little embarrassed. Now that you think about it, it was obvious that you were never in any real danger. If you were, why would anybody sign for this? She gave her belly a comforting pat as you got settled in, cooing at the feeling of you moving around inside her body. “Now, get comfy in there and don’t move around too much. I gotta get back to runnin’.”

When she ran, even as her jiggling belly swayed and wiggled, her stomach remained quite still and stable. Now that you weren’t afraid anymore, you realized it was actually quite comfortable in here. It was super roomy, and while it was a little moist, it was surprisingly dry. It was like chilling out in a big, moving, natural sauna. More than enough light poured in through the walls to let you see around, and the pink walls were some of the most comfortable surfaces you’d ever felt. You signed as you leaned your head against one of the walls, the utter relaxation distracting you from just how crazy this was.

As the ‘race’ continued, the turkey eventually caught more runners, sending them each down to join you in her stomach. They all seemed to take it much better than you did; you guess they must’ve actually read the flyer, and thus expected to get swallowed up. Either way, they all seemed like nice people, and you had fun telling jokes and making small talk with them as they were added in one by one. Eventually, after about 10 minutes had passed, about 9 of the runners had been locked away in the turkey woman’s gut, yourself included.

“Well, that about wraps it up!” Katie smiled as she reached the end of the trail. Only about three people had made it through the run ungobbled, which was about as many as she expected. She stops for a while to catch her breast. “Whew! What a workout!” She wipes the sweat from her forehead with one of her huge wings, before smiling as she pats her big belly, now bulging with all the people stuck within. “You folks wouldn’t mind stayin’ in there a little longer while I announce the winners, right?”

“Nope!” You all practically say in unison, amid your laughter.

“That’s what I want to hear!” The turkey giggled, shaking her belly playfully before she started getting dressed. Her old-fashioned dress just barely squeezed around her belly, looking like it was about to burst at any moment; but surprisingly, the fabric held firm, even when her gut bounced and jiggled as she walked. She made her way onto the stage of the amphitheater, where she looked down on the three runners that remained. “And our lucky winners are… Douglas Parker, Tina Thompson, and Sandra Bailey!” She announced over the microphone, and a few passersby clapped in applause. The turkey handed out special tickets to each winner. “Redeem these any time for an item of your choice from the Dark Meadow Estate stockroom!”

With that settled, the turkey disappeared behind the amphitheater, and got to work coughing up the other contestants. She knelt over, and the sphincter at the top of her stomach slid open. You watched as the other runners crawled up her stretchy throat, one by one. When it was finally your turn to crawl in, you were surprised by how quickly her throat muscles gripped you, and slid you up her throat in seconds, until you landed on the soft grass still covered in saliva. Soon, all the runners were out, and they all laughed and chatted as they dried off. “Get job, everyone! Even if you didn’t win, remember, at least you had fun,” she said, before adding with a giggle, “or, at least, I did. Hehe!”

Soon, all the other runners parted ways, and the turkey went walking back to her mansion, leaving you sitting there in the grass, pondering just what the hell just happened. There was definitely more to ‘Vampyre Lane’ then met the eye… but it didn’t seem so nefarious anymore. As crazy as it was to admit it, you felt almost a little disappointed when ‘Katie’ finally let you of her stomach. Compared to to her warm, soft belly, the outside world was frigidly cold and constantly uncomfortable. You sighed as you finally stood up, easily drying the smelly saliva off your clothes.

With that settled, you still had over two hours before dinner started. What should you do next?
0231.title: Caught! ... Immediately!

choices: Seth
Megan
Jacob & Donna
025.content:
** Image ID #2140858 Unavailable **


Food seemed to stretch from horizon to horizon. As far as the eye can see, pot roasts, cobblers, casseroles, pies, cornbread, biscuits, delightfully prepared dishes of all sorts were laid out along the big, long wooden table in the center of the field. In the center of the table was a huge cornucopia, from which emanated the most tempting and delicious smells to ever grace a man’s nostrils. Amidst all the food, the patrons couldn’t help but notice there wasn’t any turkey, though they realize that might’ve been offensive to the massive turkey woman standing at the far end of the table.

“We hope you are impressed by the feast! Please, take anything you like! There’s more than enough for everyone!” The turkey smiled, and indeed, there definitely was more than enough for everyone. In fact, there was so much food, everyone could probably eat all day and not put a dent in the supply. “I’d like to remind you that everything you see here was donated freely by the citizens of Vampyre Lane! Don’t worry about thanking them now; you will be giving your thanks to them at the end of your feast, as is traditional.”

“Sure beats going to your ma’s, huh?” Megan smiled as the four filled their plates, almost awe-inspired by the sheer wealth of options available. They had to pay extra for their spots at the table, as only a few dozen people could fit; the rest of the guests brought their own picnic blankets and set up strewn around the field, although you were also provided with some of Vampyre Lane’s free, delicious cooking.

“Hah! Got me there,” Seth smiled as he shoveled more food onto his plate. “This. Is. Incredible!” It seemed every food item the heart could desire was somewhere on the table. There were even some dishes nobody could recognize, and while they looked strange, they smelled delicious, so some people were eager to try them.

“They have some weird food here,” Jacob said, staring at the mystery meat with fascination. “I don’t think there’s even a name for this…” Other than the turkey, there didn’t seem to be any of the ‘animal people’ around, so if there were any locals at the feast, they weren’t wearing their costumes at least.

“It looks amazing,” Donna smiled, her face buried in her phone as she snapped some photos of her plate. “My friends are going to be so jealous.” As the family stared at their dinners hungrily, barely able to restrain themselves from sneaking a taste.

Eventually, every guest had taken their seat and filled their plate, and the turkey woman stepped up to make another announcement. “I’d like to thank you for your patience,” she says, somehow speaking loud enough for her voice to be heard by the entire field clearly. Maybe a microphone was hidden in her costume? “Now that everyone is settled in, in the spirit of Thanksgiving, I would like all visitors to say grace…” With the turkey leading them, they all chant simultaneously, their voices collecting into a booming montone...

“Bless us, oh Lord, and these, thy gifts, which we are about to receive...”

Suddenly, Jacob got a strange feeling, as if something was watching him. He lifted his head slightly, peaking around, only to see one of those animal people hiding in the bushes, watching them from the shadow. She looked like a wolf, and it didn’t seem she was wearing anything, though it was hard to tell. The moment they locked eyes, the wolf woman disappeared back into the bushes. “H-hey! Look!” He whispered in surprise.

“Ssshhh!” Donna shushed him, and with some reluctance, he bowed his head again, trying to ignore what he had just seen.

“... from thy bounty, through Christ our Lord, we pray. Amen.”

The moment the prayer finished, the guests started digging into their meals like pigs, their willpower having reached its absolute limit. The turkey woman almost giggled at the spectacle of the dozens of patrons greedily gobbling down their dinner like hungry dogs simultaneously. Jacob held out for a few moments, confused by what he had seen, but eventually he was overcome by the hunger.The moment the food touched their lips, the patrons noticed something exciting; the food here seemed to be ten times as good as it would be anywhere else! Truly, the citizens of Vampyre Lane must all be world-class chefs. Nobody could tell if there was a secret ingredient or what, but the flavor of even the most mundane food item was powerfully addictive.

As the feast continued, people started shoving food into their mouths with greater and greater fervor. To the family’s surprise, they each finished their plates in a matter of minutes, and they couldn’t help but eagerly reach for more. The mystery meat tasted heavenly, which was a pleasant surprise to Jacob, but he figured it was just a fancy dish; to his surprise, though, the green beans were just as delicious, and so was the pecan pie! As he dug into the feast, awed by the sheer variety of delicious flavors, he completely forgot about the mysterious she-wolf he saw in the bushes earlier. Megan, perhaps, ate with the most fervor, getting so into her meal that she was startled when she accidentally swallowed an entire sweet potato whole! Such a feat seemed impossible… but with a shrug, she went back to eating, not stopping for even a moment to consider the mystery.

An entire half hour passed in what felt like minutes. The patrons were now in a hypnotic haze as they obsessed over their feast, churning through food at an alarming rate, and yet the supply seemed endless. All the laughter and festivity one would expect at a Thanksgiving dinner was replaced with the overwhelming sound of chewing and slurping as the guests were overcome with the flavor. It was almost unnatural… as if some powerful hex had taken control of their minds and driven them to gluttony...

As they practically shoveled food down their throats, the patrons felt themselves grow painfully full. Fuller than most of them every thought possible. By the time the half hour had passed, all the human guests had garnered incredible potbellies, which jiggled and bounced as they desperately reached for more food. Seth’s had to take off his belt to account for his new gut. Megan, the biggest eater of the family, almost looked pregnant again. All the while, the turkey giggled as she walked aimlessly around the field, amused as the human’s minds were overcome by gluttony.

She gestured into the distance… and, unnoticed by the hypnotized humans, the locals of Vampyre Lane began to emerge. Anthros of all kinds, averaging about seven feet tall, all in various states of undress, eyed the gluttonous patrons hungrily as they emerged one-by-one into the field. Most prominent among them was a pudgy squirrel lady, wearing an apron and nothing else, who walked proudly up to the turkey.“Your curses worked like a charm, April!" The turkey woman smiled, patting the squirrel on the back with a wing.“We don't even have to fatten 'em up — they're doing it for us!"

At this point, the humans were literally hypnotized by their food, and didn't even notice the anthros as they discussed their plans. "Oh, it was my pleasure, Katie. These humans you found look absolutely scrumptious!" The squirrel lady smiled, her pudge jiggling as she walked. She licked her lips as she admired the humans. The food stuffing their bellies would sure give them a delicious taste. "Why, I could just eat one up right now..."

"Temper yourself, April. Remember, Katie was generous enough to lure them here for us, so she gets the first bite," an elegant-looking bird woman said as she followed along behind her. The dress she wore was actually quite modest, and her figure was definitely more 'well-maintained' then the others, though she was still incredibly curvy.

"Damn! How many of them are there? A hundred?" A muscular, teal-furred jackal noted, her arm wrapped around a smaller canine woman's shoulder. She wore nothing but a tanktop and a sports bra. "I wonder how many I can gulp down in one go. I might even beat my record..."

"What's your current record, Jazz?" The she-wolf Jacob had seen earlier asked. Just as he suspected, she was completely naked, more attuned to the 'natural' side of things, although she was new to being a predator.

"Five!" The enthusiastic dog by the jackal's side smiled, also completely naked. Her tail wagged uncontrollably behind her as she walked. "You should've been there, Violet! They wriggled like crazy!"

"Alright, alright. Calm down everyone. Our 'guests' here will be finished eating soon, so we need to get ready," the turkey said, before turning to a pudgy tiger woman. "Sheryl, all the gates in and out of the park have been sealed, right?" The tigress nodded eagerly, a sly smirk on her face. The turkey rubbed her 'hands' together, overcome with excitement. This was always her favorite part of the year. "Well, alrighty then. Looks like it's time to get down to business!" With a single, easy movement, she slipped out of her bulky dress, revealing her curvaceous, completely nude form to the unsuspecting crowd. She licked her lips and rubbed her belly as she eyed up her visitors, trying to decide which one would be the first to fill her stomach.

"Well? Don't keep us waiting!" The equally nude wolf man by Violet's side said, his arms crossed. "Who's it gonna be?"

Who does the turkey gobble up first?
025.title: The Thanksgiving Feast

choices: The Turkey!
The Jackal!
The Wolves!
0251.content:
The turkey seemed nonplussed by his rudeness, the same amused smile locked on her face. "Well, let's see here..." She said, making her way back to the main table. "Eenie meenie miny moe..." She sing-songed, poking each guest on the head as she passed by. Each of them were too obsessed with their meal to even notice. "Catch a tiger by the toe..." She comes closer and closer to the family of four. "If he hollers, let him go..." Eventually, she pokes Megan on the head, but passes her on, tapping Jacob and Donna as she walked by. "Eenie meenie miny..." Suddenly, Seth was torn from his meal when huge wings wrapped around his sides, lifting him up in the air with terrifying ease! "... moe!"

Jacob was always the skeptical one. Even when he was just as embroiled in his meal as the others, it never fully hypnotized him. There was still some awareness in his mind, clawing to break free. When the turkey poked him on the head, distracting him from the meal, he was halfway knocked from his hypnotic trance... and when his father was torn from the seat beside him, that finished the job! The boy suddenly tensed up, as if woken from a dream as the hypnosis clears from his mind, and he realizes the situation he was in. Jacob turns, eyes wide with fear, to see the turkey woman from before as naked as the day she was born, with his father's head lodged in her beak!

Without a moment's hesitation, Jacob screams at the top of his lungs, watching the turkey take another gulp and pull his father deeper into her throat. The other patron's attentions were torn away from their meals, as they all turn to witness the spectacle of the man kicking and flailing as he was swallowed whole by the giant turkey woman. "Damn it! That kid will ruin the hypnosis!" The wolf man yelled.

"I'll take care of him," the nearest anthro, the jackal, stomps swiftly towards Jacob. Just as he was about to reach out to rescue his father, he felt the giant, muscular canine woman grab him the arm, hoisting him up in the air.

"No!" He said, struggling against the canine's grip. "Dad!" As the jackal dragged him away, he could only watch in horror as Seth's legs wriggled in the air, his body creating a sizeable bulge in the turkey's throat. With a few more gulps, even Seth's legs disappear, as the turkey pulls him down into her body with incredible speed, the man not even making a bulge in her big, round, feathery belly. Before he could even mourn, the jackal spun him around, and before he knew it, Jacob was staring into the canine's huge, hungry maw! "No! Let go of me!" Just as the canine was about to wolf him down, he reached up and punched her squarely on the nose, desperate not to meet the same fate as Seth.

"Ow! Damn it!" The jackal yelped, reflexively letting the human go as she stumbled back, clutching her snout in pain. Fueled by his adrenaline rush, Jacob immediately rushed back into the crowd, waving his arms wildly.

"Run! Everybody! Ruuunnn!" He yelled, realizing the horrifying extent of the anthro's plans. The other visitors had been pretty thoroughly awakened from their hypnosis at this point, though at this point, it might already be too late; the other anthros immediately pounced on the nearest human, swallowing them down with similar ease as the turkey did. Jacob rushed back to his family, seeing Megan and Donna were paralyzed with fear as they watched the bird woman swallow Seth whole and alive. "Eat this!" He shouted like a battlecry, picking up a nearby dinner roll and tossing it at the turkey's face. As if fate was on his side, he hit his mark once again, the roll colliding with the turkey's eye, blinding her and giving his family some extra time. "Run!"

He didn't have to ask twice. Megan and Donna immediately joined with the clamor of the fleeing visitors, now a veritable stampede as the humans rushed for the nearest exit as quick as they could. In the crowd, they quickly lost track of each other; all they could do was try not to fall over and get trampled. All the anthros had filled their bellies with at least one human already, but they were far from satisfied, running after the stampeding humans like a pack of wolves, picking off the slowest and weakest on the edge of the crowd. They were much faster then any human, but they could only swallow one person at a time, and each person they devoured bought the rest some time.

This worked out for the smartest and the fittest... but Megan had eaten more then any other person in the crowd. She was a reasonably fit woman overall, but all that extra weight really slowed her down... and soon, she found herself lingering in the 'danger zone' on the outskirts of the crowd, huffing and puffing as her rounded belly bounced up and down, certain she would be picked off soon. Surely enough, her sprint was interrupted when she felt a pair of claws wrap around her sides, lifting her up in the air! "Aaahhh!" She squealed as she was spun around, finding herself face-to-face with her captor...
0251.title: Panic!

choices: North
West
East
South
Suddenly, Lee saw the Easter Bunny
03.content:
It's Easter, the day you have been waiting for! You usually went around town finding eggs, but this year was going to be different. You were heading to Vampyre Lane, or Hopping Lane as it was called on this holiday. You had heard the rumors of how it only appeared on holidays. For Easter, you had heard that the chocolate eggs were the tastiest. You had also heard that there were fun games to play and nice people to meet. Hopping Lane was even said to have the Easter Bunny roaming around, and those who were lucky to find her would get a special reward.

Unfortunately, you hadn't heard about the bad rumors about it, one of them specifically being that people who go there often don't return. Since you were oblivious to the danger, you excitedly walked towards the area. By your side, you had your two best friends. Your friends Bethany and Lee. They were both looking forward to the day as much as you were. However, Lee was twice as excited, he absolutely loved Easter more than anything.

When you got to Hopping Lane, you noticed a sign at the entrance.

Warning!

If you are human, than beware. If we meet, I shall attempt to catch you, and I have never failed. You will become part of my hunt and soon be captured. If you want to avoid this fate, leave now.
-The Easter Bunny


"What do you think this means?" Beth asked. You shrugged, though you suspected this was some sort of joke, the sign gave you a funny feeling.

"Maybe we should leave." You said, taking a step back.

"Are you kidding? This sounds awesome, come on!" Lee said and started to run ahead. You and Bethany looked at each other and then ran to catch up. Once you caught up, you saw a sign that pointed to different directions.

North: Egg hunt
West: Easter Truth or Dare
East: Egg decoration
South: Candy buffet

You and your friends decided to head…
03.title: Time to get cracking

choices: Lee
Beth
You
032.content:
"Ooo, an Easter themed truth or dare," Lee noted sarcastically. He couldn't help but chuckle at that, and began going in the direction the west-pointing sign specified. You saw Beth shrug at Lee's movement, and she walked in the direction he led.

"Uh, guys?" you said as the two of them walked away. You glanced back towards the entrance, thinking back to that sign written by this "Easter Bunny" lady. You still weren't sure what that meant, but you had this bad feeling in your core. Is that warning sign serious? Might your friends be in danger? ...You felt like it couldn't hurt to keep an eye on them, so you too began heading west. You could see Beth and Lee ahead, and you began picking up the pace so you were right behind them.

As you guys traveled, you glanced at the houses about. They looked like normal houses, save for the decorations. Fake green grass seemed to line the windowsills, a few painted eggs in each of them. You could also see a few rabbit plushies the size of dogs on several fields. However, a few of the fields seemed to have rabbit plushies that had longer limbs than normal rabbits, which seemed to work with a thinner frame and a different frame to make them look a little more human...

Soon, Lee stopped suddenly, and you could see his confusion, even from behind his head. You rose a brow at that, and Beth herself seemed confused. You moved around him to see his face, where you saw his wide eyes and his gaping jaw. Confused, you looked at where he was facing, only to mirror his expression. Forwards, you saw a bunch of picnic tables, each round and bearing a nest of colored eggs on them. A lot of the picnic tables are moved away, leaving one table in the middle of an empty space. Around the table, however, were the source of the confusion.

There was a... pink lioness? That definitely looked like a lioness: large feline, lion-like tail, no main... However, on top of the pink fur, she seemed to bear more human-like proportions. Well, model-like more like it, seeing as she seemed to bear an hourglass figure, complete with long legs, thick hips, and a rotund chest. Around the table were young-looking animal... people. Next to her was some orange-dyed snow leopard boy. Next to him was a young, chubby polar bear boy with his fur dyed blue. And across from the lioness was a goat boy with green fur, who was in a very peculiar position. The other boys looked on nervously as the lioness' foot was extended over the table top, the goat boy pressing his face into her sole, his hands grasped around its side.

You could swear you heard a few sniffs from him while the lioness rhythmically tapped the table top, wriggling her toes on the goat's forehead as she did so. Next to her was a mechanical timer. When you couldn't hear sniffs, you could here the tick of that timer, it getting closer and closer to 0. Soon, it rang out. And at that, with an intense gasp, the goat yanked himself way from the foot, before turning around where he's sitting and coughing, taking in deep breaths of fresh air while the lioness put her foot back under the table.

"Nicely done," she complimented. She glanced over to the humans, and her expression seemed to light up. "Alright boys, we can continue this later!" Upon hearing that, the three other animals with her perked up, and instantly fled from the table, the lioness chuckling. "C'mere, you wanted to play a game, right?" At that, you and your friends seemed to freeze up, as if suddenly realizing you were under the gaze of a predator. "Well? Come on then~" At that, as if compelled by some invisible force, you guys moved forwards towards the table she sat at, and you sat at spaces similar to those boys from earlier. Lee sat to the lioness' right, Beth sat to her left, and you sat across from her.

"You know truth or dare, right?" she said. You all glanced nervously at each other, and nodded, feeling like so much as saying the wrong word would mean bad things for you. "Good! I tend to go first, and I offer others the chance to exchange their dare for one, and only one, truth. If you don't do as I ask, then... I'm not sure you'll want to know what happens after that." With that, she began pointing around the table, and you could swear you heard her saying "eenie meenie minie moe" to herself. Eventually, she decided to choose...
032.title: West

choices: You go through with the dare...
You exchanged the dare with a truth...
You wait until she is distracted before trying to flee!
0323.content:
She points at you and eep! You didn't know how to react after she points at you.
"Truth or dare young man." She says with a smirk. You gulp at this and don't know what to say before you come to a decision...

"Dare..."

The feline smirks at this and wags her tail. "Was hoping you would pick that..." She then gets up and exposes her seat.
"I dare you to be a cushion while your two friends have their turn...oh, and don't try to squirm out during this..." She then grins, showing her fangs to you...

You had another decision to make...
0323.title: You!

choices: You play as one of the other two kids as they play Truth or Dare
You feel yourself start to sink into the furry butt!
She keeps you as a cushion longer pretending she "forgot" about you as she farts
Despite the scare, you try to slip out from under her ass!
03231.content: You decided against better judgment and decided to go through the dare. You notice that the lioness's seat was a lot bigger than the other seats. The Lioness smirks and turns around, lifting up her tail and spreading her thick butt cheeks before sitting down. You gulp as you worry you might get crushed, but her butt turned out to be quite soft. You also noticed that your whole body is easily concealed by her thick rear. As you hear the lioness above talking to the two, you pick up a sudden, rank smell. You then realized that the big cat above you has pushed out a silent fart over you, but you seem to be the only one to smell it. You cringe and get tempted to struggle, but then you remembered seeing her fangs and worried she would try to eat you...you hope this doesn't last long....
03231.title: You go through with the dare...

choices: Nice
Naughty
04.content:
** Image ID #2142316 Unavailable **


Magic isn’t real. Not in our universe, at least.

But in other dimensions, the sky’s the limit. Somewhere out there in the multiverse, every possible variation of reality exists. There are versions of Earth populated entirely by giant, talking crab wizards; versions where very conceivable rumor, folk tale, or conspiracy theory proves correct; even versions where the moon is made of cheese. Sometimes, the denizens of a universe grow so powerful, so magically or technologically adept, that they’re able to open gates to ‘neighboring’ universes, on special occasions.

Today was one of those special occasions. Christmas eve. A time when magic was in the air. On a day like today, everyone was restless with burning excitement for Christmas. People were singing carols in the streets, building snowmen, or settling in around the fireplace with their families. Not everyone was having a very happy Christmas, however. Some people, through one circumstance or another, were truly alone during the holidays, with nothing to look forward to on Christmas morning.

For those people, this year, there was a glint of hope. A couple hundred select youths from around the world were mysteriously given tickets to an incredible town calling itself Candy Cane Lane. Amid the hustle and bustle of Christmas eve, somehow, no one noticed these youths sneaking out into the snowy night, driven by an almost supernatural sense of curiosity. According to the ticket, all they had to do was walk to the nearest bus stop, and as long as they had the special ticket, a fancy, Christmas-themed bus would stop by and pick them up.

The driver would be a cheerful, generic elf with rosy cheeks and pointy ears. After driving aimlessly for awhile, he would veer off into the wilderness, travelling down mysterious roads that nobody knew existed. No matter where they were in the world, the bus would always take them to same place. After waiting for only a few minutes, they’d see beautiful lights glowing over the horizon, as the bus drives them towards a huge, incredible, snowy little city. They’d know they were inside when they passed through an immense archway, which read;

Vampyre Lane CANDY CANE LANE
Because nobody deserves to be alone on Christmas!


There, they’d find the entire town decorated with what must’ve been billions in Christmas decorations. Entire buildings seem to have been renovated to fit the occasion. Eventually, the bus would take them to the center of the city, where a grand parade was being held by the elves. As they stormed out of the buses, the children were delighted by the gorgeous light displays, parade floats, and beautiful festive choir music.

The main event of the parade, though, was the last parade float, on which a cheerful, chubby man with a snow white beard sat on a christmassy throne, ho ho hoing his head off. However, this man wasn’t just some lame mall santa. No, everyone could tell with a glance that there was something magical about him. There was no doubt in anyone’s mind that he was the real deal. This was ol’ Saint Nick himself. Once the parade concluded, the visitors were set free to explore the town to their heart’s content, all promised that the next morning, they would be given the ‘perfect gift’.

For those who had been kind and well-behaved over the last year, Candy Cane Lane would be a place of unparalleled wonder, where all their dreams could come true and any number of magical events could occur. However, for those who had been ‘naughty’, the town could be a dangerous place indeed. Santa and his elves were far from the only denizens of the snowy little town, after all…

So, before we begin, which one are you?
04.title: The Most Wonderful Time of the Year

choices: Candy Cane Park
Santa's Workshop
Somewhere Else
041.content:
You used to love Christmas. Now, it seemed like the most miserable time of the year.

You weren’t a scrooge or anything. But just a few years back, you and your family were involved in a car accident that deprived you of your parents, your brother, and even your ability to walk. A ‘drunk driver’, the social workers said. You were all just in the wrong place at the wrong time. Well now, Christmas, the day you had once beamed with excitement for every year, now just reminded you of all you had lost. Your foster parents usually tried to surprise you with some gifts, or a trip, but it all paled in comparison to crowding around a Christmas tree with your family. This eve, you were grimly prepared for another quiet, lonely Christmas…

Then, suddenly, a strange ticket blew through your window, with your name on it somehow, your breath was taken away. It claimed to have been sent by Santa himself… and how could it not have been? The way it was carried on the wind, it could have only been delivered by something truly magical. Sure, maybe you were a little too old to be believing in Santa Claus… like, way too old, but at this point, you were praying for a miracle. In the dead of night, you snuck out the door as best you could in your wheelchair, rolling towards the nearest bus stop as fast as you could. Sure enough, that special festive bus arrived immediately, whisking you away to places unknown…

The second you arrived in Candy Cane Lane, you knew this was the real deal. Somehow, you felt the distinct, palpable sensation that you were crossing over into another universe entirely; a universe where anything was possible, and any dream could be made to come true. When you saw the parade, the magic of this place was only confirmed. The lights show was the most beautiful thing you’d ever seen, bringing tears to your eyes. And at the end, when the saw the old, rounded man in that grand throne, he had a sense of kindness, generosity and wisdom about him no normal human could accomplish. You knew immediately that it was him - the elusive ‘Santa’.

You didn’t question what you were seeing in the slightest, too excited to be skeptical. All you could think about was exploring the magic of the place, and uncovering every secret it had to offer. And maybe, at midnight, when the gifts were supposedly to be given… maybe you’ll get a miracle after all.

Once they let you roam on your own, you rolled your way around the town aimlessly for a while, just taking in the sights in awe. Every building had a comfortable, retro wooden cabin aesthetic, and was covered in lights, wreaths and stockings. Bakeries staffed by elves were offering free food; stages all around town were performing elaborate plays for all to see; colorful fireworks were continually going off in the distance. People all around seemed to be just as giddy as you were, laughing and celebrating together. Most beautifully of all, an aurora borealis was lighting up the sky, streaks of green and purple shimmering in the heavens. The more you explored, the more you were convinced this place was truly magical.

Eventually, you encountered an elf that was handing out maps. You took one graciously, eagerly looking it over to see what was available. It showed all sorts of businesses in the city offering free services, but also recommended a few areas as the ‘main events’ of the Christmas celebrations. You didn’t have all that much time, so you decided to start with those first.

The closest was Candy Cane Park. Apparently, there, they were erecting the largest Christmas tree in the world; it was supposedly so tall it reached the clouds! At the party in the park, you could meet some of the city’s local residents. Around the same distance was Santa’s workshop, which offered an in-depth view into exactly how the magic of Christmas is performed. There, you would be able to meet the big man himself, as well as his twelve reindeer. If neither of those interest you, you could always head somewhere else...
041.title: Nobody Deserves to be Alone on Christmas

choices: The Yule Goat
The Yule Cat
The Yule Boar
0411.content:
A tree so large, it could touch the sky? That seemed impossible. You assumed the map was simply exaggerating… at least until you looked up and, sure enough, there it was in the distance. Even from miles away, the tree towered over the town like a skyscraper, a beautiful light attached to every single branch. It almost seemed to cut through the beautiful, starry night sky; a beacon of light in the heart of the town. While Santa’s Workshop seemed tempting, you knew you had to see this tree up close.

As you rolled into the park, you noticed it was bustling with activity. Beautiful lights were strung between every tree, and the grass was covered in a fresh few inches of snow. People were skating on a frozen lake, while visitors shared delicious-smelling pastries on the shore. Lovers danced together in a courtyard while elves played soothing melodies onstage. You immediately lost yourself in the festivities, grabbing some delicious pastries and munching down on them while chatting with the other visitors.

It seemed people had come here from all over the world; most of them didn’t even speak the same language, and yet they came together in harmony and understanding to share the joy of the season. Every person you met, you immediately understand so deeply, it felt like you’ve known each other your whole lives. You made new friends instantly, even across language barriers, driven by an almost supernatural sense of comradery. Soon, you were singing Christmas carols on the shore with a dozen other visitors, all dressed up in santa hats and christmas sweaters.

The next hour flies by in what feels like seconds. Eventually, you start to realize that you’ve been so wrapped up in the joy of the moment, you haven’t even stopped to consider the apparent magic present in the park. Like, for example, the 7-foot tall animal people wandering around. You stared at them suddenly, as if woken from a dream. You’d noticed them before, but for some reason didn’t spare them a second thought. Everyone else seemed to be acting the same way, treating these talking, bipedal animals like they were completely normal.

You suppose you shouldn’t be surprised. This entire town seemed magical. Still, you had no idea what anthropomorphic animals had to do with Christmas. Elves, sure… but these? You didn’t know quite what the make of them. Well, whatever. They seemed nice enough. Maybe you should just go talk to one of them, see what they’re all about.

You decide to approach...
0411.title: Candy Cane Park

choices: Jule is hungry for more then just sweets
Jule has a hankering for a very special massage
Jule takes you somewhere more private
04111.content:
You decided to approach the anthropomorphic goat-like creature offering free candy near the base of the gigantic Christmas tree. As you drew yourself closer towards the center of the park, you blushed as you now could make out the feminine features on her body. The magical creature was covered from head to toe in downy, white colored fur, with droopy ears and short horns placed atop her head. You could scarcely make out a set of fangs protruding from her mouth, but any fear that may have come from that revelation was put away by the sheer warmth and care she eminated.

However...and you were very ashamed of yourself to admit this, but you only noticed those particular features after you recovered from the shock of seeing her more prominent ones. The goat women was, to put it as politely as possible, incredibly well endowed with her build. She had a distinguishable pot belly, which would make sense since you have failed to see any food other than the warm pastries being offered in the snowy city. But you could only guess that most of the seven foot tall goat’s weight went to her hyper voluptuous chest and rear end.

Two white, fuzzy orbs the size of basketballs bulged out heavily over the sides of the Goat’s Christmas getup, swaying back and forth with every step, up and down with every breath. You chuckled a little, thinking that it could only take the magic of Christmas to keep her top from splitting at the seems. A stubby tail wagged contently atop dual beach ball sized spheres, a green and red skirt only covering a less than a quarter of it’s mass. A couple of the more ‘naughty’ kids made sneering remarks about the goat’s figure behind her back, but a harsh glare was apparently enough to shut them up.

You shook your head to knock off the snow that was piling on your hair as it fell, and mustered up enough confidence to approach the creature. You didn’t feel any fear coming to her, rather...embarrassment. You honestly thought that she was very pretty, but you were at an age where your mind tended to wander to places that weren’t for the Holidays. The goat, having just sent a younger child on his way with a chocolate bar, noticed you wheeling up to her and gave you a smile.

“Hello they're, little one!” The taller goat women bent down to see you better, giving you in turn a better view of her ample cleavage. Your blushed intensified. Normally, you didn’t like being referred to as ‘little, considering your age and your actual height standing up, but with her you didn’t seem to mind. “I hope your having a great Christmas Eve! Can I get you anything?”

“H-hi I’m-“ you instantly beat your chest and cut yourself off as you heard how big pitched your voice was. The goat giggles knowingly and gives you a couple moments to calm down, as if this was a regular occurrence for her. “Sorry, I actually wanted to ask you a couple questions, if you don’t mind.”

“I don’t mind at all sweetie~” the goat women chimed, wiggling her soft paws around your waist as she carefully gripped your form. You let out a surprised gasp as she lifted you up from your wheelchair and into the air. From thin air, a wooden chair materialized behind her, wide enough to handle her generous backside. She sat down, guiding your form down onto her lap as the other kids helped themselves to the unattended candy. It was all free anyways. “Ask away.”

You felt uncomfortable being pressed up towards the goat’s fluffy chest orbs, growing and detracting as her lungs filled with air. Still, you continued to suppress your less than desired desires and thought it would be rude to turn down the lady’s offer. “First off...um, w-what should I call you?”

“You may call me Jule, Julebuck the Yule Goat.” Jule petted your head as you involuntarily rested it against her breasts. You didn’t want to, but it was hard to not do so when she hugged your form in such a way that your head naturally wanted to lean towards her. The warmth her body gave off pulled your body into a state of comfort you never felt before, and her mammaries, although you didn’t want to admit it, served as fantastic pillows.

“I’ve never heard of the ‘Yule Goat’ before.” You admitted, shifting your body as much as you could to get more comfortable on Jule’s form. “Was I supposed to know about you before?”

“Oh no, cutie pie. Unless you come from Scandinavia or Germany, I’m pretty much unknown in the Christmas stories.” It than dawned on you that Jule was speaking German. You never questioned the dissolution of the language barrier the city seemed to provide, but it was curious that you could have a full fledged conversation here without knowing what they were saying.

“Oh! So, all the other animals here are from Christmas legends?” You gestured to the various other Anthro animals wandering throughout the town. The Reindeer and the Polar Bears made sense to an extent, but you were puzzled by the elephants and tigers, kangaroos and wolves. Jule gave off another cutesy giggle.

“Actually, those are visitors like you children, though not in the way you would think.” She fetched a cookie from a passing penguin offering them in a basket and offered it to you. “Think of them as...very generous benefactors, without whom none of this would have been able to happen.”

“O...kay…” you were a little disappointed by the vagueness of her answer, but didn’t press the question further. It added to the mystery of the whole night. You took the cookie from Jule’s paw and nibbled at it. “One last question than...is they're anything I can help you with?”

Jule blinked and gave you an amused smirk. “That is very generous of you to offer, my little one, but I don’t think…” the Yule goat’s gaze sort of wandered off as the wheels in her head began to turn. “Well...there's ONE thing, but it’s only for more my special helper. Would you like to be my very special helper, sweetie?”

“I...I do. I really do!” You responded with a little bit more enthusiasm than you intended. You don’t know what it was about Jule, but the way she smiled down at you and warmed you inside made you feel so...spectacular. You really wanted to be with her, for as long as the night would permit you.

“What would like me to do, Miss Julebuck?”
04111.title: The Yule Goat

choices: A holiday party packed with anthros and magical creatures
The town square, alive with festivities and cheer
The local mall to do random acts of kindness for the various anthro patrons
042.content:
It wasn’t your fault most people considered you a bad kid. Sure, most people called you spoiled, but your parents just always got you what you deserved. And yeah, maybe you caused your parents a bit of trouble, but sometimes they really got on your nerves, they deserved it. And don’t even get started on your teachers, always calling your parents up to the school to try to get you in trouble, but it never worked. You sat on the Christmas bus playing some videogames on your Gameboy. Everyone else was looking out at the snowy December night and making “ooh’s” and “aah’s” at the snowfall. They must all be stupid or something, it’s just snow! Videogames are way cooler than snow.

The bus stopped in the Christmas village and you were all escorted out where you all watched the village parade with Santa. You scoffed at the whole parade. All the others were saying that was the real Santa. Could they really bed that gullible? That beard was clearly glued on. Once the parade ended an anthropomorphic reindeer woman walked up to your group and told you all to freely explore the village and enjoy yourselves. As your group cheered and happily dispersed you started to walk away when you felt the reindeer woman’s hoof-like hand pat your head, “Have a wonderful Christmas Eve deary!” You scoffed at her too, “Yeah, sure. Nice costume by the way.” The reindeer giggled, “Oh, how cute. It’s not a costume honey. I’m the real deal. You see, in this village the magic of Christmas-“ The reindeer stopped in her tracks once she noticed you were walking away and weren’t listening. You yelled back to her, “Yeah right.”

You walked around the snowy city streets, looking at all of the toy shops and bakeries. All of this would probably be exciting, if you were a poor kid, probably like most of the other chumps who came here. But your parents were loaded, they could probably buy this whole town twice over if they wanted. You were starting to get bored here, maybe you could get some kind of early bus home or something. You walk back towards the town’s entrance and towards the parked Christmas Buses. No one was on the bus, but you saw a polar bear woman dressed in a red and green sweatshirt and pants combo, consoling some crying boy nearby. She had him sit on her bent knee as he cried into her furry belly and she soothingly rubbed his back, “Hush sweetie, it’ll be ok. I promise.” You walk up to her, “Hey lady!” The polar bear’s head darts towards you, “I’m sorry honey, just give me a few more minutes with this boy and I’ll be right with you. If you need immediate help there’s a Help Center down Pine Ave.” You huffed in annoyance, “I don’t need help. I just wanna go home, this town is boring.”

The polar bear’s head shot right back at you. At first there was a look of surprise, then it turned into a scowl. Rolling her eyes in annoyance, the polar bear woman growled, “So you’re one of the naughty ones, huh?” The polar bear peered around and called over a reindeer woman, the one that greeted you before. Handing the crying boy over to her the bear said, “Take care of him. His grandma passed away a few months ago and it’s still troubling him.” A look of sympathy crossed the reindeers face, “I’m on it Hilda.” A kind smile grew on the reindeer’s muzzle as she cradled the crying boy and started walking off, “I know honey. I was sad too when my nan-nan passed but always remember, they’ll always love you. And that’s another thing…” The reindeer carried the boy off, leaving you with the scowling polar bear woman, who was staring daggers at you. You didn’t get what the big deal was, “What?”

The towering polar bear Hilda snarled at you, spitting polar bear drool on your face, showering you in her hot, nasty breath, and showing off her bright pink gums and impressively sharp and big teeth, “You’re in for it now you little turd!” How did that crying boy even get so close to this thing, it stinks. You scowl back at her and cross your arms, “Try me. Whatever you do to me, my parents will sue you and whatever company you work for into bankruptcy. So don’t you dare touch a hair on my head.” A devious, but equally frustrated and enraged grin spread across her muzzle, Hilda was stupefied by your meanness and lack of care for others, “Oh, you’re gonna have a wild time here tonight brat. Ya’ know this village is meant to reward good humans and punish and reform bad one’s right?”

You narrowed your eyes and crossed your arms, “Yeah? So?” Hilda’s grin grew wider, she knelt down and forcefully grabbed you by the collar of your shirt and brought you up to her grinning muzzle. Now it really stunk. You waved a hand in front of your nose, scrunching your eyes and even pressing your hand against Hilda’s wet nose, trying to push her away, “Geez, get a Tic-Tac or something you freak!” A predatory, animalistic growl escaped Hilda’s throat, “Firstly, young man. I am a LADY, not a freak. Secondly, you are most definitely on The Big Man’s naughty list. So allow me to start administering your punishment.” The polar bear started walking off, deeper into the town, still holding you by your shirt collar, “Let me go! This is not A Christmas Carol. I don’t need to be visited by any ghosts, or smell your nasty breath or learn some dumb lesson about peace on earth, I just need to go home so I can get my cool presents already.”

Hilda rolled her eyes. There were always young humans who were a bit spoiled, maybe having a little trouble with expressing empathy, but this one? This one was especially rotten, almost cartoonishly so. A smug grin formed on Hilda’s muzzle as she raised you back up to her grinning black lips, “Don’t worry. By the end of the night you’re going to learn quite a few lessons. One of them being, never talk back to a polar bear.” Hilda opened her maw nice and wide, giving you a good view of the pink inside of her drooling maw and the darkness of her esophagus, BBLLOOORRRPPP! She belched in your face, making you gag on her gas blast and punch her in the muzzle. Hilda took on a stern look as she glared at you.

Your punch didn’t hurt, but the fact that you had the gall to hit her made her angry, “Listen brat. Here’s the deal. On Christmas Eve in Candy Cane Lane, time stops, literally. You could spend a whole decade here and never age, and once you leave here it’ll still be Christmas Eve of today’s date. Since you’re such a brat, you’re going to explore every single nook and cranny of Candy Cane Lane before you’re allowed to leave… and trust me… the residents here can be very sweet, but they don’t take kindly to naughty, selfish little humans like you. Hopefully once tonight is done, you’ll learn a lesson or two, that is the whole point of this punishment after all.” You struggle in Hilda’s grasp, “W-what are you gonna do with me then, burp me to death?” An evil grin formed on Hilda’s muzzle, “Glad you asked!” Hilda brings you to…
042.title: Naughty

choices: She takes a seat on the couch with you as her cushion
She ties mistletoe to you, everyone gives you a slobbery kiss
She forces you to serve the guests food and drinks
0421.content:
Hilda sped through the main street before turning into one of the many picturesque and brightly lit alleys. Possessed with intent and completely ignoring your protests she turns left and right, navigating the mazelike network of tightly packed houses. Only once you tried to bite her did she stop.

"Do you really want to measure your bite up against a polar bear." She cooed, putting on her toothiest grin. "Now shut your trap and stay quiet. We're almost at the party."

"I don't wanna go to your dumb party!" You shouted. "Your party is gonna be lame. My parents always give me the coolest party. For one, they don't have any smelly bears in them. And they also get me a-" You were cut off as Hilda lifted her free arm and flung you face-first into her armpit. She lowered her arm again, sealing you in the stinky pit. With her little human pacified she finished the last leg of her journey in no time at all. When you were finally released you were livid.

"You stupid bitch! I'm gonna tell my parents what you did! I'll have them buy this whole village and fire everyone! Then I'll laugh as you waste away in the gutter, where smelly beasts like you belong!" To your surprise your little tirade seemed unable to sour her mood any further. She just kept a pleasant smile as she showed you the door. "My, you must be trying for some kind of record, the most rotten kid in the land. But don't worry, we'll get you sorted out. To start, since you're such a big fan of all the animals here, we've thrown you a party!

The polar bear pushes open the door and loud cheering thunders out. The house was packed to the brim with all manner of beasts. They wore various bright getups, all stark green and red. You saw horse people, more reindeer and even several more polar bears. There were even elephants and rhinos. There were so many of them.

"See? Doesn't this look like fun?" Hilda said with a joyous voice.

"No, I wanna go home." You scoffed.

"Home? But you are home, champ." One of the elephants greeted you and Hilda, walking up to the entrance. "Come on in, but be careful. You better watch your head." She rubbed her forehead a little. In spite of being an elephant woman, she wasn't much taller than the rest. Nevertheless, the doorway would've given her issues. Hilda nodded and stepped in, holding you under her arm. The party was in full swing and the various animals seemed to be having fun. But amidst it all the only thing you managed to get out of this was the smell. So many beasts packed together worked up quite the stink for your delicate nose. Nobody else seemed to notice, but you couldn't believe how vile everything was.

Worst of all was the polar bear, whose strong grasp was impossible to break. You struggled as best you could, but she either ignored it or simply didn't notice. After spending a few minutes mingling with the guests Hilda finally had some time for you again.

"Now seems like a good time to start the punishment, don't you think?"

What does she do?
0421.title: A holiday party packed with magical creatures

New Years

April fools day
Other
