0513.content:
You are Sam. You are 18 years old and have a few friends. However, despite your efforts, you couldn’t get a girlfriend. You tried a few things like flirting and giving gifts, but there wasn’t a single girl who liked you that much. You were a little embarrassed today because you didn’t have anyone to be with on Valentine’s Day. You didn’t want your friends to tease you, so you decided to take a long walk.

On the way, you stumbled across an area you had never seen. You noticed a sign that said “Vampyre Lane”. Though a lot of people had heard of it and were afraid of the place, you honestly hadn’t heard of it. You turned and saw another sign that read:

Welcome!

Come and join the fun, we have lots of fun games for couples on this special day. If you are alone, then have no fear. There will be lots of new people to meet, and they want to meet you as well. So don’t be shy and walk right in.

When you saw this sign, you had some doubts. However, this could be the place where you met your dream girl, besides what did you have to lose. You walked deeper into Vampyre Lane and looked around. Most of the houses had decorations like red streamers and big hearts. You had a funny feeling as you looked around, one that you liked. You also noticed that a fair down the street. Even though you were currently alone, you were sure you could have fun. You decide to…
0513.title: The day to find Love

choices: Go to my place
Go to the fair for some games
05133.content:
Startled by the voice, you turned around to see a peculiar girl. She wore a green bra and panties like a normal person, but her body was covered in fur. She looked so much like a golden retriever that it left you with no words. The lady was quite tall, your head leveled with her shoulders. The canine smiled and took a step forward.

“Hello, I’m Daisy. Who might you be? I don’t see visitors very often.” She said. You spaced out for a few seconds before you were able to respond.

“I’m Sam, it’s nice to meet you. You look beautiful.” You said nervously. You suddenly noticed that she had a tail, and it was wagging pretty fast.

“Thank you for the compliment. It takes quite a bit to look this good. Back to you though, is there anyone with you?”

“No, I’m alone.

“What!” As Daisy’s eyes widened, she reached and grabbed your arm. At first, you wanted to struggle, but her fur was soft and warm. “How could you be alone on Valentine’s Day? You’re so cute, I thought you were taken by someone. Well it’s good that you met me then, I was looking for a cute boy. She pulled you in between her breasts, making you blush like crazy. You pulled back and looked at her smile.

“Does this mean… you’ll be my valentine?” You felt awkward asking that question. She leaned in.

“Do you accept?” As you nodded, she smiled more and licked your face. This was the first time a girl wanted to be with you like this. You felt excited and hugged her. “Now now, you can thank me later. For now, let’s…
05133.title: A dog-gone lady

choices: Head to the park
Go to one of the house parties
A local anthro resident approaches you
052.content:
It was New Years Eve once again. Which… wasn’t all that exciting for you. You and your friends weren’t old enough to legally drink yet… so no parties or bars for you. Christmas was still the favorite holiday of you and your friends, and you were still riding the high of getting that new game system a week ago. But you had heard of this strange place called Vampyre Lane, it was notorious for seemingly appearing in random areas out of nowhere on certain holidays of the year. It was most well known for supernaturally appearing around random small towns around Halloween, thus the mythical nickname Vampyre Lane. This neighborhood boasted tons of fun and festivities for anyone who entered… but urban myths also said that anyone who enters never returns. Since you and your friends have nothing going on tonight, you planned on sneaking out and trying to search out this elusive Vampyre Lane. If it was even half as much fun as some of the students in your school have described it… it should be a blast if it appears tonight.

You got on a heavy jacket and opened up your bedroom window. Thankfully your bedroom was on the first floor so you sneakily pop out of the window and gently close it before sprinting down the street. You meet your friends in the local square, Coin Square. There was a small park that you saw your other two friends, Beth and Leo. You wave to them and they approach you, “So… any idea where we could find this place?” Leo pointed near a clearing near the local woods just a few blocks down, “Apparently Mr. Brixton-” You interrupt, “That crazy guy? He can barely hold down his teaching job, let alone his own sanity!” Leo shrugged, “It’s all I’ve been told about Vampyre Lane. He said he saw it seemingly appear out of nowhere in the woods that way… when he was walking his dog three Halloween’s ago.” You and Beth shrug. Beth replied, “It’s the best we’ve got. Let’s go and see.”

You three walk towards the large clearing that led to a deep patch of dark woods. Considering it was 9 o’clock at night during the winter it was nearly pitch black in those woods. You three walk into the moonlit clearing and you see something. You spot some lights deep in the woods, they’re stationary and look like streetlights and house lights. You need a second to catch your breath from surprise, “Guys… I think it’s real… we’ve found it.” Vampyre Lane, the mythical party neighborhood, was actually real all along. Every other day of the year where you were looking would just be some trees and thick thorn bushes, but tonight it’s magically transformed into a whole new neighborhood. You three happily rush towards it. After passing through the large metal gates you look around to see what looks like an upperclass gated community, lit up with tons of loud parties and festivities.

You spy a huge concert and carnival-like event going on in a park down a few blocks. There’s also the rows upon rows of houses with loud parties going on inside as well as residents and guests spilling out into the streets. Down another row of blocks you spotted a ball-drop-like event happening where everyone was huddled around a ticking clock, the bars and clubs around that area also seem to be buzzing with life. Everything seemed like a normal neighborhood… until you took stock of the residents. There were a few patches of humans here and there, probably visiting like you and your friends, but this town was overwhelmingly populated by people dressed in animal costumes… strangely realistic animal costumes. You turn to your friends, “S-so, where do we go from here?”
052.title: New Years

choices: The Towns Beach or The Ice Cream Parlor
One of the House Parties or The Park  BBQCookout
A local anthro bumps into you three
053.content:
It’s another hot summer day in your neighborhood. It was the 4th of July, and that meant your family was taking a quick one-week vacation down to the shore to soak-up the sun and enjoy the holiday. Your parents were even nice enough to let your two best friends Aaron and Chelsea come along. You drove in late into last night and simply unpacked all your things before going to bed, but today was July 4th so you and your friends decided to go out and have some fun at the local beach. Your parents just told you to be back before dinnertime. You three got on your bikes and started pedaling towards the beach. It was a bit of a trek to get to the beach, your parents rented a vacation house a ways away from the beach to save some money, but it’d be worth it once you get there.

You three saw a sign up ahead that read ‘Independence Day Party At Vampyre Lane’. You three stopped your bikes and looked at each other. You spoke, “A party, huh? We should check it out!” Aaron shook his head, “I don’t know. We don’t really know this town all that well, maybe we should just stick to the beach?” Chelsea smiled, “Aw, come on. It can’t be that bad.” You nodded and smiled reassuringly at Aaron, “Don’t worry, we’ll be in-and-out, then we’ll head straight to the beach.” Aaron was always a bit skittish and a momma’s-boy, but you always tried to cheer him up when he was afraid.

You three started pedaling down the path the sign directed you towards. The path was a bit bumpy and led through a wooded area, but as soon as you got to the other side you smiled in awe as you saw a huge, bustling beach town. There were ice cream shops, a beach in the distance, condo’s bumping loud EDM music filled with loud partiers, swimming pools, a park with fireworks and a BBQ cookout, and so much more. You guys looked around in wonder. You turned to Aaron and grinned, “See? Better than you expected, right?” Aaron grinned and nervously nodded.

However, you did notice something a bit off. Walking around in equal number… or possibly outnumbering the various human families, teens and kids in the town were animals… walking and talking animals. Much like the humans in the town they were mostly wearing swim trunks, bikinis or other summer-wear. You turned to Chelsea and Aaron, “Are those?” Your two friends nodded, “I think so.” You weren’t sure what to make of them… but no one else was screaming or panicking, so you decided to go with the flow. You turned and noticed a plaque that read, ‘Vampyre Lane: A Town For Anthros – Where All Humans Are Welcome’. So those animals must be the locals. You turn back to Chelsea and Aaron, “So where should we go first?”
053.title: Fourth of July

054.content:
It was a day for mischief and pranks, the best day of the year for you and your friends, April Fools Day. You already pulled some pranks in school today, filling the teachers coffee with worms and putting a whoopee cushion in the principal’s office chair. You and your best friends Peter and Regina walked down the street, joking about the hilarious events at school today. As you three walked down the street you saw an arrow sign on the side of a fence reading “Path to Vampyre Lane.” You turned to Regina and asked, “Hey guys, that says it leads to Vampyre Lane?” Regina replied, “Vampyre Lane? I thought it only appeared on Halloween?” Peter chimed in, “I heard it only appears on Holidays.” You shrugged, “Well… today’s a holiday right?”

You two friend nodded in approval, “Let’s go then.” You and your friends walk down the path, following the signs. You end up walking through a few winding streets until you’re led into the woods. After about fifteen minutes you three notice a large gated community, with the top of the black iron gates reading ‘Welcome to Vampyre Lane’. Peter said in awe, “Woah, it’s actually real.” You were all giddy with excitement, Regina chirped, “Let’s go inside!” You all rushed into the gates and looked around.

The neighborhood seemed to be fairly upscale and rich, with large, lavish houses lining the blocks. You saw another sign that pointed in three directions. One arrow was pointing towards a huge house titled ‘The Prank Mansion’. The second arrow was pointing towards a park called ‘The Humorous Haven’. The third arrow pointed towards a row of houses, seemingly open to the public called ‘Joyous Jokes Road’. You turned back to Regina and Peter, “So where should we go?”
054.title: April fools day

choices: A male trick or treater
A female trick or treater
A male guy watching their sibling
A female watching their sibling
A rude prankster
1.content:
It is a dark and spooky night. Those dressed in bandages and spooky clothing run rampant through the streets, and they're... getting candy. It's Halloween, and the mood is in full swing. Everyone's dressing up, everyone's spreading playful fear, and everyone's enjoying their time. Halloween is also the perfect time for urban legends. One of them tells of a strange neighborhood, called Vampyre Lane, deep in the nearby forest. They say that the greatest of spooks and the most realistic of costumes reside there, yet no one has been able to confirm the rumors. Those that visit the neighborhood are said to never return again.

Before we investigate that rumor, who are you?
1.title: One Spooky Night

choices: Bad Omen House
Spooky Graveyard House
Tasty Treats House
Creepy Haunted House
Move on to the next houses
11.content:
You had been eagerly anticipating this day all month. Finally, the first halloween you and your friends were allowed to go trick-or-treating all on your own! Unfortunately, so far it’s proven… disappointing.

You look mournfully down at the empty pillowcase you were carrying. You’d already hit every house in the neighborhood, but the area had been going through a tough time recently. Most of your neighbors had already moved out, and the ones that remained weren’t in a very giving mood. Your family was pretty poor, so halloween was the only night you really got to binge on candy… but so far, you had barely gotten anything. So far, you had only gotten a gross bag of good & plenty from the nice old lady down the block, and some candy corn from your friend’s mom. To make matters worse, two bullies on your street, Gary and Ron, had been following you around and tormenting you endlessly, seeing that you were alone.

While your parents had all forbidden it, your friends and you agreed that you had to leave your neighborhood if you wanted any chance of enjoying this halloween. You had narrowed down a good spot -- Vampyre Lane. Everyone else was afraid of it, spreading rumors of supernatural creatures stalking its roads, but you were too old to believe in that sort of thing nowadays! Among your brave ranks was Kevin, a scrawny boy with wide-rimmed glasses who was dressed as a fireman, and Maria, a hispanic girl with long black curly hair who was dressed as Cleopatra. Maria’s mom also made you bring along her annoying brother Hugo, who was dressed as a tiger. You were dressed as a pirate, though your costume wasn’t very good, so you ended up having to explain it to everyone you met.

You had to walk through the woods for a while to reach the neighborhood, but when you finally made it, you were in awe. You had expected Vampyre Lane to be some creepy old, abandoned little historical neighborhood, but it was actually a beautiful little gated community right in the middle of the forest. The huge, metallic front gate was covered in halloween decorations, welcoming trick or treaters and inviting them to enjoy their stay. Every house was huge, and their lawns were lavishly covered with halloween decorations, that looked like they must have taken all month to set up. Best of all, due to the neighborhood’s fierce reputation, the streets seemed to be completely empty. You might be some of the first ones here!

“C’mon, guys, w-we’re not supposed to be here!” Hugo whined incessantly, dampening everyone’s spirits. He had been a literally scaredy cat all night, but by now it was just getting grating. “I want to go back! I want to go baaack!”

“Let’s try one house, first, okay? Then we can see how you feel,” Maria patted her brother on the head reassuringly as you walked up to one of the biggest, most expensive mansions on the block. The three of you wait, experiencing varying degrees of excitement and nervousness, as you ring the doorbell.

A few seconds later, you hear footsteps approaching the door, and when it finally slid open, you were in awe. You had seen some expensive halloween costumes, but this one really took the cake! The curvaceous woman who answered the door seemed to be dressed as a tiger, but the make-up effects were amazing; it looked like she actually had orange fur running all along her body! She even had two big, fluffy ears, and a snout on her face you assumed was a mask with animatronics inside, given that she actually smiled when she looked down on you. Her tail swung back and forth behind her, seemingly of its own accord, and her ears twitched a little as she welcomed you. To make matters stranger, she was exactly seven feet tall, towering over all of you! Her costume looked completely realistic -- absolutely indistinguishable from what a real anthropomorphic tiger would look like! At least… you assumed it was a costume, anyway…

You blushed a little when you noticed she seemed to be dressed incredibly skimpily, as if she had shown up to the door in her underwear. You figure wearing much more might’ve ruined the effect of her fur, but still, it was a little awkward. You also noticed that she seemed to have big, wide paws for hands, as she lifted a bowl of candy out in front of you. For a moment, you grew a little nervous. Her outfit was almost a little… too realistic.

“What are y’all looking at me like that for? It’s just a costume!” The tiger giggled. You realized that all you had been staring at her in silence this entire time, in awe.

“Oh! Uh, ahem!” You compose yourself, lifting up your pillowcase. “Trick or treat!”

“Smell my feet, give me something good to eat…” She sing-songed the rest of the chant as she reached into her bowl. She dropped into your bag… and entire, full-sized chocolate bar, a bag of kit-kats, and a bag of mini-oreos! “Well, I definitely have my fair share of treats… and maybe even a few tricks! Hehe!” You looked down at your loot in awe as you step aside, letting Maria nervously walk up to the tiger and present her bag. Maria and Kevin were given similar bounties, and the three of you giggled with glee over the delicious candy you’ve obtained. Finally, Maria’s brother Hugo stood up to the lion, looking up at her nervously as he presented his pillowcase.

“Aww, a lil’ tiger! Why, your costume’s even better than mine!” She smiled brightly upon seeing his costume, reaching down and ruffling his hair. “You’re so cute, I could just eat you up!” Hugo seemed to calm down immediately, smiling and giggling as the huge paw ruffled his moppy hair. He’s always been a fan of big cats, tigers especially. She reaches into her bowl again, only to come up empty. Or at least, she pretended to come up empty -- she was too tall for you to tell if the bowl was actually empty or not. “Uh oh. Looks like I’m fresh out of treats, actually…” She frowns, only to look down and see the devastated look on Hugo’s face. “Well, I can’t just let a fellow tiger go hungry!” She says to reassure him, stroking her chin contemplatively. “Tell you what. I’ve been making some brownies and such for a party later tonight. Maybe you can help me cook -- be my assistant taste tester!”

Hugo seemed excited by the idea, and walked forward to follow the tigress; but Maria grabbed his arm before he could enter. “Uh, he’s with us,” she says, not trusting the woman.

“Well, either way, I can’t just let him walk around by himself out here,” the ‘tiger’ crossed her arms, sounding a little more assertive all of a sudden. “Honestly, I have half a mind to call your parents…”

Your heart leaped at this. If your parents knew you had come all the way here, they’d be so angry at you… you’d never get to go trick-or-treating again! “No no no! It’s fine! Really!” You insisted to the tiger, pulling Maria’s hand away. “W-we’ll just be back later tonight, when we’re done!” The tiger smiled at this, gesturing at Hugo to come on in. You can all only watch as he rushes inside excitedly, disappearing around a corner deeper into the house.

“Don’t you worry yourselves. I’ll take good care of your friend here,” she smiled, as she slowly slid the door closed once again. “Have a lovely halloween!”

Like that, the door slammed closed, and there was silence again. As you walked back down the woman’s driveway, Maria seemed a little worried, but you and Kevin were relieved that Hugo would be out of your hair for the night. It meant more candy for the three of you, anyway! At this point, you figure this had to be a community full of weird, eccentric millionaires who loved halloween a little too much. It was basically a jackpot! You chomped down on mini-oreos graciously as you considered the next house you’d stop by.

The houses all seemed largely identical, but they had different ‘themes’ for the decorations on their front lawn. One of the houses seemed to be themed around bad omens, such as broken mirrors, black cats and salt. You’d have to walk under a ladder just to get to the front door, which was a funny touch. Another house had a fake graveyard in the front lawn, with little animatronic skeleton hands ‘reaching’ out from the graves. Another seemed to be based on delicious halloween food, with giant, fake pumpkins, candy corn, and other tasty-looking decorations littering the lawn. While most of the houses seemed to be just fun and goofy, there was one ‘haunted house’ on the block that seemed to be trying to be scary, with spooky strobe lights and scary, ghostly noises played on speakers.

You almost couldn’t wait to see what kind of candy you’d get next! You chose the next house almost without thinking...
11.title: Trick or Treat!

choices: Random Chance
Random Chance
Random Chance
111.content:
The closest house’s lawn seemed to be an unorganized mishmash of various bad omens. You recognized most symbols, such as the ladder, the broken mirrors, the ouija boards.. But there were also quite a few you didn’t recognize, like the pair of shoes, or the fancy pocket knife. You weren’t sure if this was supposed to be ‘scary’, but the three of you did have a nervous chuckle as you had to duck under a ladder on your way to the door. You eagerly ring the doorbell, excited to see what you’ll find on the other side.

You didn’t hear any movement on the other side of the door for a while, and for a moment you assumed the house was empty, until you finally hear the doorknob slowly turn. Instead of opening normally, the door just sort of slid open slowly… so slowly you almost assumed it had just been blown open by the wind, before you said a pair of big, glowing yellow eyes peek at you, with distinctly feline pupils. Just from the position of their eyes, you could tell that they were also about 7 feet tall, which unnerved you somewhat. They didn’t offer you any candy or anything, they just… stared at you from the darkness of their house. “Uh… trick or treat!” You finally announced, nervously, trying to break the silence.

“You walked under my ladder.” A scratchy but distinctly feminine voice replied.

You stood there, blinking. “... what?”

“You walked under my ladder,” she reaches out a hand, with long claws and black fur, pointing at the ladder behind the three of you. “Don’t you know that’s bad luck?” She insists ominously, almost whispering now. “Something terrible might happen now.”

“Heh, yeah…” You chuckled nervously. You figure she was just trying to scare you, though her voice sounded completely serious. Eventually, she pulled the door open entirely, looming over the three of you. She, herself, seemed to be some kind of voluptuous black cat, some of her ‘fur’ somehow glowing yellow, which, in the darkness, gave her the impression of being a skeleton. It was a clever costume, of course, though moderately confusing. Plus, you suspected that the woman might be completely naked, but with her black fur combined with the thick darkness, it was impossible to tell. She seemed to be staring at three of you curiously, as if she had never seen anything like you before. Apparently, you were just as fascinating to her as she was to you. Her ‘costume’ seemed to be just as expensive as the tiger woman you met earlier. You wondered if there was some kind of store just for these weird animal costumes. Was the height part of the costume? “... trick or treat?” You repeated, waiting for her to offer up some candy.

“Yes. Yes, I have treats!” She said, her ears perking up as if you had reminded her. She had a very strong accent of some sort, as if English wasn’t her first language. “Cookies! Very, very cookies I have prepared all month!” She rushes away excitedly, disappearing into the darkness. “I will be back!” You and your friends were left alone again, staring into the darkness of the woman’s house.

“We should leave,” Kevin whispered, nervously, the second she left.

“What? Why?”

“She’s… weird. I think she’s up to something.”

“She seems to be from out of country. Maybe this is her first Halloween,” you whisper. “Besides, she made cookies. How could we turn that down?” Just as you finished your conversation, the cat returned. The tray of cookies in her hands seemed completely fresh, despite her insistence that she’s been working on it all month. The cookies were still fresh, warm and soggy. They looked sort of like simple chocolate chip cookies, but… black, for some reason? You had never really seen anything like them before.

“Cookies! Take one! Be careful!” She says, holding them eagerly out in front of you. The three of you reluctantly take a cookie each off the tray, about to put them in your pillowcases. “Don’t put them in your bags! Eat them while they are still hot!” She insists, staring at you in anticipation. You.. weren’t sure if this was the best idea, but really, what’s the worst that could happen?

The three of you look at each other nervously, before biting from your cookies all at once.

Exactly what happens next depends on random chance. For your sake, here’s hoping you get lucky...
111.title: Bad Luck

choices: ...put the jar on a shelf
...dumped you onto a table
...brought you to some corner called "Good omen"
1111.content:
Deep down, each of you feared that something did happen with those cookies. Maybe that's why the pause after eating felt so heavy with tension. You felt like some monster was about to jump out at you all of a sudden. Fortunately, there's no such monster... for now. Instead, you felt a horrid sensation. All of a sudden, the world around you grew bigger... and bigger... and bigger. You soon realized you were shrinking! You and your friends!

"What the-?!" you shouted out.

"I knew it!" Kevin shouted as he too shrunk.

"Shut up, Kevin!" Maria spat back as she shrunk. Soon, you all were barely taller than the grass around you. Before you could consider your situation further, you heard that accent.

"I told you, something terrible would happen!" the lady in the house said. "You're in no condition to walk around yourself!" Then, she stepped out, holding a jar. You all collectively tried to run away, but, in a couple of strides, she was already upon you. You could only watch and run futilely as the jar slid forward. It scooped you and your friends up, and she brought it up, holding it right side up. The three of you had no chance of escaping. "Who knows when the effects will wear off? I'll have to keep you safe in my house until then."

You all banged on the sides of the jar, shouting and screaming for her to release you. She brought you in, and...
1111.title: Random Chance

choices: She swallows you three. Can’t go anywhere inside a cat belly
She shoves you three between her buttcheeks
11111.content:
You could only watch as you were moved into the cat lady’s house. Despite all your banging and screaming the cat lady did not respond to your frantic behavior. The movement of the much larger cat lady walking shook the jar a bit, knocking you three around against the sides of the jar and even against each other. The inside of the feline’s house seemed very inviting and well furnished. You’d probably feel more comforted if you were your normal size. You saw she was headed to the kitchen and moved you up towards her set of cabinets. To the side of them there were some shelves with houseplants and food condiments on them, although the food condiments seemed cat themed, reading titles like ‘Odor De Fish’ and ‘Catnip Perfection’.

After placing the jar on the shelf the cat nodded to you, “Now, you stay and wait for bad omen to wear off.” The cat turned around and started to walk off, then you had a plan.

You bang against the side of the jar, yelling out, “Wait! Miss! If the curse wears off and we grow big again won’t we break the glass all around us? That could hurt us really bad.”

The cat seemed to have heard you and turned around, walking back up to the jar with an understanding expression, “I suppose you have good point little one. We don’t want to cause little ones any harm.”

You wanted to scoff at her for that. She’s already caused plenty harm by shrinking you. You smile up at her, “So, will you let us out?”

The black cat nodded with her own smile, “Of course.” She screwed the lid of the jar off and tilted your glass prison once again. You three were sent stumbling out onto her leathery paw. You shuddered in fear, looking at the paw beneath you that easily held you, Maria and Kevin. You felt truly miniscule.

You peered up at the cat lady’s grinning face, “Thank you miss. Now can you make us big again?”

The cat raised a furry brow and grinned, chuckling a bit, “Big? Make YOU big? Oh, no, no, no young one. I can only give bad omen. No good omen. That’s for the bear lady two doors down. We can only wait until bad shrink omen wears off.”

You were a bit annoyed by this answer and in equal measure terrified. Mentally exhausted from your whole ordeal you blurted out, “Well then how long will it take then?”

The cat lady’s glowing, feline eyes widened as she chuckled nervously and scratched her ear, “Well, um… hmm. Could be a few minutes… or a few weeks. I’m not sure.”

Kevin complained, “B-but we have school in the morning.”

Maria groaned, “I think we have bigger things to worry about right now than school, Kevin.”

You were about to complain before she wagged a disapproving claw at you, “No, no. No more questions. I must find new place to keep you until you grow back. Hmmm, where to put little ones?” Then the cat’s eyes widened as she snapped her fingers, with a grin she answered, “I know perfect place.”
11111.title: ...put the jar on a shelf

choices: Reader's choice
Reader's choice
111111.content:
The cat lady hoists the three kids over her gaping maw. They dangle off of her paw, trying their hardest to hold on. Eventually their little arms couldn't hold on anymore as they plummet into the cat's mouth. You, Kevin, and Maria land on the soft but scratchy tounge. You run to the opened part of the mouth before the cat closed her maw, enclosing the three in darkness. "Maria, I'm scared." "It should be okay." immediately their world shifted as the tounge began to push you and the rest further back.

*GULP*

You all become compressed together as the throat muscles squeezed and pushed the three of you into the depths below. Outside, the cat lady's throat forms a decending lump and traced its decent with a finger. She traced it go down her throat, behind her chest, then finally into the pit of her pudgy belly. The cat gave her belly a quick rub before patting it. She moaned in delight feeling them plop into her stomach.

"Mmmmm, there. Now you safe until bad omen goes away." she hears the muffled thuds and screaming coming from her tummy. All of which cause some unnatural movement from her belly. "Now now little ones, I promise no harm to you." she said soothingly. "How can you be so sure we're safe!? You just ate us!" Kevin shouts. "I promise you are safe from outside." "What about inside!?" you scream. "What if you forget about us!?" "Then you will be nice curves on my hips." this really got the micros struggling. The cat lady giggled. "Joke. It was only joke." that didn't stop the three of you. She giggled again before patting her belly. She walked off to another room, most likely her bedroom. Her gut moved along bounces it's captor on the inside.

She walks into her bedroom and climbs into her bed. Laying on her back, she continues to rub her full tummy. Watching it move slightly and hearing muffled struggles. The cat woman licks her chops, remembering their taste. Before closing her eyes to drift of to sleep.

...............how much time has passed?
111111.title: Kept in a cat's belly.

choices: Sent into future, is it past midnight or will the cat ask for a personal favor?
Swap out your bad omen for another one and hope for the best
11112.content:
The cat, now having scooped you all up, moved back inside her house. You three were disorientated by the movement of the jar as the giant feline walked. Eventually she made it to her wooden kitchen table and screwed the lid off the jar. The jar tilted again and you three were sent spiraling, falling on top of one another out of the jar and onto the table. Once you three were out of the jar you quick tried to make your escape.

Maria let out a terrified shriek. Kevin cried, nearly in tears, “Let’s get outta here! I wanna go home!” You three scattered around the table, looking for a safe way to scale down it without outright jumping.

The cat rolled her eyes at this, “Ugghhh!” She knelt down and easily snatched you all up. First her big, leathery paw came down on Maria, then you, and finally grabbing the frantic and crying Kevin. Soon you were all placed in her cupped paws, right in front of her face, giving you a good whiff of her fishy breath. You were much too high up to even think of escaping now.

The feline gave you a stern and angry look, “You can’t just go running around like that. You could get hurt. Look how tiny you are.”

Maria groaned, still angry and defiant even against this skyscraper-sized black cat, “Yeah, well whose fault is that lady? You’re the one who shrunk us!”

The cat growled lowly, “I had to. It is part of your punishment. If you receive bad omen I must administer proper punishment. It is my job as the local Omen Mage.”

Maria snapped back, “I don’t care what your job is, I wanna get my brother and go home.”

The black cat raised a brow, “Not in that state, young lady.”

The much smaller girl spouted, “Then change us back!”

This made the feline snarl and snap her jaws at you three, “I CAN’T! I wish I could but I only deliver bad omens young one. You must show patience and you will return to normal in time.”

Kevin, in a frantic voice asked, “In how much time?”

The cat shrugged, shaking her head, “I cannot tell. The omens are different every time.”

You started to think and then got an idea, you yelled up at the gigantic feline, “Hold on! Is there anyway we could change our bad omen? Like could we swap it out for another one? Or… you said you’re a mage right? Like a magical mage? Could you cast another omen on us… maybe one that will cancel out our shrinking?”

Kevin squealed in fear at your idea, “Are you kidding, you want this cat lady to do more weird magic stuff to us?”

You turned to your friend, “Kevin… do we have any other choice?”

Kevin contemplated and then answer, “I-I mean… um… just wait! We’ll just wait it out. Patience, right. How long does it take for the shrinking to wear off?”

Cat the pondered a bit, “Well, it could be few hours to a few months.”

All three of your eyes widened. Maria joins in, “I don’t wanna take that chance. I wanna get back to normal, go get Hugo, and get out of here.”

You nod, “Alright. What should we do than miss?” The cat gets lost in thought, just staring at you. Her malodorous fishy breath still wafting over you. Her eyes widen as she comes to a decision…

Does the cat lady use a time spell to send you three forward into the future where the shrinking affects have worn off? Or does she swap out your shrinking omen with another bad omen? Be careful! If you time travel to the future you may be sent too far, and end up getting trapped in Vampyre Lane until Halloween rolls around next year. At the same time, it takes a lot out of a mage to send three trick-or-treaters like you into the future… she might want a favor or two in return. Or you could swap your shrinking omen with a new bad omen, but will this one be worse? What does she decide on?
11112.title: ...dumped you onto a table

choices: ...5 spaces
..2 spaces
...6 spaces
11113.content:
You saw you were coming close to a corner with "Good Omen" written over it. The three of you had no idea what could be in store for you here. This weird lady obviously had some sort of magic up her sleeve, which could mean anything could happen. Soon, you saw the "Good Omen" itself, and you had no idea what to think. On a table in the corner, you saw a relatively large, mahogany board. On one end, you saw a half circle with "START" carved into it. A long, curving rode of blocks connect that half circle to another half circle with "GOOD OMEN" carved into it. You saw 30 spaces between the start and "Good Omen" space. Some of the tiles were a different color, and they had phrases carved into them. A few of them had some flavor text carved into them, followed by something like "Skip Your Next Turn."

"Our saving grace is a board game?" you asked incredulously.

"No no no no!" the lady stuttered out. "It's a sophisticated device I constructed under the strict orders of spirits. Those facing bad omens simply need to comply with the rules of this device and, after starting at 'Start,' cross the path until they reach 'Good Omen.' You'll each be handed a movement device your size. You'll take that device and roll it. Whatever number comes up, you cross that many omen squares. If you land on a square with writing carved into it, I must follow those omens. When you reach 'Good Omen,' you're bad omens will dissipate."

You all couldn't believe your ears. You were gambling, quite possibly your very lives on a board game. You weren't sure whether to be deeply offended or terrified. "To determine who goes when, I'll roll you out real quick. Brace yourselves." Suddenly, she tilted the jar, and you all fell out. You each tumbled down, you first, then Maria, then Kevin.

"C'mon, let's get off of this thing," Marisa said. She began to walk towards the carving marking the border to "Start," when the giant lady put a hand in front of her, stopping her.

"Hang on! If you don't follow the rules, the omens will never leave you!" she said. Marisa backed away, and the lady began to fish in a compartment on the side. She pulled out, clenching something in her hand. She dropped something on the Start space, and you saw the "transportation devices" were, in fact, tiny, six sided dice. They were still half your size, but they were tiny for the lady. "The pirate was first, so he must roll first."

You each grabbed a die, and decided you didn't want to risk ticking her off. You could only play her game now. You each got into position, you right in behind the border. "6 spaces away, I see 'You stumbled onto a bog of eternal stench! You're forced to stay there for one turn.' 2 spaces away, I see 'You wandered onto a monster's platter! You're trapped until the other subject or subjects roll a sum of eight.' Do remember I must follow the omen as written. Please don't hold what I do against me."

"What on Earth could that mean?" you asked, too quietly for her to hear. You decided you may as well play this out for now. She wasn't going to let you out of the play area. You held the die overhead, and threw it forward. You heard it clack against the board as it rolled and tumbled, before eventually stopping on one side. The lady looked over at the die, before declaring how many spaces you were moving. You were gonnna move...
11113.title: ...brought you to some corner called "Good ...

choices: Random Chance
Random Chance
111131.content:
You clench your eyes shut, as if that would somehow halt the answer from reaching your ears. You heard the cat lady’s voice ring through your ears, “Go. Go now boy. Move 5 spaces.” You feel the feline’s furry digit pressing against your back, pushing you forward. You start to walk down the path of board game spaces, you breathe a sigh of relief when you notice the fifth space is blank. You turn to Maria and Kevin and smile, giving them a thumbs-up. You just hope they can make it safely across themselves.

The cat woman places one of the large dies in front of Kevin, “You. Next. Roll little one.” The woman seemed hurried, as if she wanted this game to be done and over with as soon as you three did. She narrowed her glowing eyes as Kevin shook in fear, holding the die in his hand. For as long as you’ve been friends with Kevin you always knew he was a nervous wreck and in high-pressure situations he was borderline hysterical. One time in Science Class when the teacher announced a pop-quiz that he wasn’t prepared for Kevin started hyperventilating… so much so, he had to be excused to the nurse’s office. You could only imagine how he felt right now, shrunk down in a strange neighborhood with a giant cat woman scowling down at him.

That was enough to keep you on edge; Kevin must be terrified. You started to regret coming to this place. “You can do it Kevin,” you yell. Kevin shook and started to sweat, with a scream he threw the die. He quickly shielded his eyes as if the die would attack him once it settled on the board. There was a long pause throughout the room. The die obscured the square it was on so neither Maria or you could tell if he was about to be punished or not. The cat lady pinched the die, lifting it up to reveal Kevin’s fate.
111131.title: Safe For Now

choices: Random Chance
Random Chance
111132.content:
You took a moment to compose yourself. Everything you thought you knew about the world had just fallen apart around you. Magic was apparently real, first of all, and the square–cube law apparently doesn't actually apply. Most importantly, all the evidence pointed to the black cat being an actual talking, anthropomorphic animal. Such a thing boggled the mind... and yet there she was in, in the flesh, towering over you like some kind of goddess. All you had to do to earn her favor, though, was play a little board game. How hard could it be? You took a moment to look over the spaces before you, to get a feel for just how far you needed to go...

◖⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹ ⏹◗


You had about 30 spaces to go before you reached the end of the cat lady’s game. Most spaces were plain, gray blocks that had no apparent effect. A few of the blocks were colorful, though, their effects hand-scrawled upon their surfaces; such as the orange spaces, which simply shifted the flow of the game in minor ways. Most prominent, and most worrying, were the bad omen spaces, which all advised some frankly disconcerting 'challenges'. Due to the strange wording, you couldn't rightly tell, but you prayed those bad omens weren't literal. Some of them were downright terrifying in their implications. Just as you were considering this, the cat urged you forward with one of her huge paws, and your friends watched on in horror as you obliged, leaping from one space to the other until you had gotten to where you needed to go. You looked down at the space below you – red. The cat clicked her teeth."Oh, dear..." she said, and you scream out when she lifts you by your shirt collar before you can even read the tile. "Well, I suppose this is as good a time as any to demonstrate the bad omens."

You instinctively squirm and wriggle in her grasp as she brings you up to her giant face, hating the feeling of vulnerability. "My apologies, little one," the feline whispered, low enough for only you to hear it; and when you opened your eyes, you found yourself staring right down her dark throat as she spread open her jaws. Before you could even react, you were plunged right between those waiting jaws, as she slammed her lips shut so your friends wouldn't have to bear witness to your fate. You were immediately soaked completely in saliva as her tongue pressed all over the sides of her mouth, rolling and squeezing you within the tight confines of her maw. You thought she was simply toying with you, as cats would with their prey; in reality, though, she was simply trying to position you in just the right way to slip you down her throat. Unlike most anthros, she wasn't the best at swallowing such lively meals whole, and certainly didn't enjoy it as much. She just wanted to get this over with. All the while, you were pressed against her cheeks and teeth as her tongue batted you around, until you eventually just didn't have the energy to fight back anymore. With that, you were laid on top of her tongue like it was a bed; it was even comfortable, for a while. Until her throat muscles locked down around your feet, of course, and dragged you down into the darkness with one terrifying pull...

"Oh my god..." Despite only being spectators, your friends had an even better idea of what was going on than you did. While you were disoriented and blinded by darkness and saliva, they could clearly see the incredible bulge you made as the cat tried her hardest to force you down her throat. You were struggling with all your might as you tried to get her to spit you out, the cat cringing and gagging as you pushed at the confines of her throat for a while. But against the overwhelming power of the larger feline's body, you exhausted quickly... and the bulge in the cat's neck soon disappeared behind her impressive bust. The entire trip, from her hand to her belly, felt like it lasted hours, but in reality, it had only taken a few seconds. The feline coughs and gasps for air once the obstruction in her throat had finally passed, as she felt the familiar sensation of tiny hands and feet against the walls of her belly.

You recoiled in horror once you realized where you were. You felt like you were in a giant, pitch-black sauna, the gurgling and groaning of the gut around you like a cacophony in your ears. You fumbled around blindly in the dark, trying to claw your way out of the corrosive pool of juices that rose up to your knees at the bottom of the stomach, but the walls were far too wet and slippery for you to climb free. As you tried to navigate in the darkness, you accidentally grabbed onto something hard and chalky that had been floating around in the gastric juices. Exploring it with your hands, you realized what you were holding... a skull, from one of the board game's previous victims! Your screams were muffled completely by the walls of her belly as you flailed around, consumed by panic. Meanwhile, your friends were staring at the cat's belly, certain that they had just watched you die. "I understand your concerns, little ones, but for your friend's sake, I recommend you hurry up and continue," the cat said, rubbing her growling stomach, wincing uncomfortably at the movement within "I'll try not to hurt him, but according to the rules, he must remain in there until the two of you collectively roll a sum of 8. Firefighter, you're up next."

"W-what if I land on a red space?" Kevin asked, cowardly as ever.

"Then a relevant trial will be administered, until your friends continue the game and satisfy the requirements," the feline replied, as if this much was obvious.

"What if we all land on red spaces?" Maria asked grimly.

The black cat paused, looking at them sadly. "... it's best not to think about such things right now," she said, handing the dice to Kevin. "Roll." Kevin closed his eyes as he was forced to lift the dice over his head. Finally, he worked up the courage to toss it onto the table with all his strength. Exactly what he rolled was a matter of chance...
111132.title: First Trial

choices: Random Chance
Random Chance
1111321.content:
Kevin’s heart skipped a beat when he saw he rolled a 6. Was that one of the bad ones? He couldn’t remember. He held back tears as he hopped from tile to tile, convinced he’d end up getting swallowed like his friend. Eventually, he landed on the sixth tile away… and broke down when he saw the color. Red. Before he could even read the tile’s inscription, he felt something lift him into the air by his shirt collar. He immediately squealed and wriggled against his captor, only to freeze up like a deer in headlights when he noticed he had been lifted up to the feline woman’s face. He was certain he’d be devoured. Unfortunately, judging by the look on the cat’s face, an even more humiliating fate was in store for him. “I’m… sorry for this one. Truly. It’s quite distasteful, but…” The feline frowned, also seeming a little uncomfortable with this particular ‘trial’. “Let’s just get this over with.”

This time, Maria was smart enough to avert her eyes; watching her friend’s fate play out would only distract her from the game. She needed to stay calm, now more than ever. Both of them expected the cat to simply swallow him, like she had you — and Kevin, having braced himself for a trip down a cat’s throat, was equal parts relieved and confused when she instead brought him behind her back, lowering her hand down the length of her sylphlike body. His confusion only reached its peak when he reached his apparent destination, and found himself held aloft in front of the cat’s rear end. Even from a normal perspective, the otherwise skinny feline’s behind was prodigious; from this size, it was enormous! Despite the circumstances, he was, for a moment, enraptured by the sight. As he stared at it, it seemed to get even bigger, until it finally eclipsed the entirety of his vision. Eventually, he snapped back to his senses and realized it wasn’t getting bigger… he was getting closer!

In another moment, Kevin suddenly found himself somewhere dark, soft and morbidly smelly. On second thought; he thought he was shrouded in darkness, but in reality, he was simply surrounded by long, pure black fur. His soft surrounding was actually pillowy skin, squeezing in on him from both sides. He realized where he was pretty quick — it didn’t take a genius to put two and two together. The feline cringed and winced uncomfortably at the human’s squirms, as she pushed him deeper into her crack with two fingers, trying to push the unlucky soul into a more convenient position. Withdrawing her fingers, she gripped her round cheeks with both hands and pressed them together as tightly as she could, restraining her tiny captive between them so he doesn’t just accidentally slip free. With the human settled, she sits down on a chair by the table, just to restrain Kevin even tighter.

Hearing that the gruesome process was finished, she turned back to see the feline all alone, shifting uncomfortably in her seat. Kevin was nowhere to be seen, and Maria assumed the worst. She was completely unaware of her friend’s current sweaty, musky, claustrophobic prison. All she knew for sure was that she needed to get her head back in the game, and mentally calculate the possibilities.. She could free both her friends with this very turn; she just had to roll a 3, a 4, or a 5. That’s a 50/50 chance. “Urgh… alright,” The feline frowns, obviously unhappy with what she has to do. “Go ahead and roll.” She gently hands the die to Maria, who’s busy pondering her next move. She was always pretty strategically minded, but no matter what plans she considered, her mind drew a blank. It seemed her only choice was to just roll the dice and… hope she gets lucky. Resigning herself to her fate, she closes her eyes, holds her breath and tosses the die with all her might.

Her fate, indeed, is a matter of chance...
1111321.title: Second Trial

choices: Random Change
Random Chance
11113211.content:
Her mind screamed at her not to take this kind of risk… but if she gave up now, her friends were doomed. She had to at least try. All she had to do was not land on one of the bad omen spaces, and they would all be safe. She closed her eyes, trying to gather all her courage as she lifted the dice above her head… only to toss it forward with all her might! She took a deep breath, before daring to open her eyes and see what the dice landed on. … three! What was that again? Maria’s mind had been so addled by fear, she had totally forgotten if that was a red space or not. But she felt strangely compelled to hop forward anyway, eventually landing on her space and seeing that it was, indeed, grey. In most games, that wouldn’t even be particularly surprising… but here, Maria felt more relieved than she ever felt before in her life, almost jumping for joy! Even the feline woman seemed to ‘clap’ with the edges of her fingers, applauding the move. “Congratulations! Lucky roll!” The black cat smiled, as if genuinely rooting for the trick-or-treaters. “Please allow me a moment to free your friends.”

The cat stood up from her chair and lifted one leg slightly, digging between her soft, pillowy cheeks to retrieve Kevin, drenched in sweat and smelling surprisingly gross. Apparently, she had silently passed gas while he was in there. She placed him gently back onto his tile as he gasped for fresh air, before turning her attention to the human in her belly. She started hacking and gagging, like a cat trying to cough up a hairball, as a bulge worked its way up her throat, until she finally spat you onto her hand, covered in saliva. You were limp, covering your eyes as they adjusted to the light. Compared to the cat’s stomach, the room-temperature living room felt like it was freezing, and the air felt and smelled fresh and clear. She wrapped you up in a napkin, letting you use it as a towel to dry the juices off you, as she placed you back on your tile. “I will give you a moment to recuperate.”

“Guys!” Maria called from her tile. “Are you alright?”

“Yeah, I’m fine,” you said with a shiver, surprisingly calm considering the circumstances. The experience of being swallowed by the cat was so surreal, to your memory, it felt like a dream.

“Well, I’m not!” Kevin finally worked up the energy to scream, decidedly less calm about the whole situation. He stood up, pointing an excusing finger at the cat. “YOU! You put me… put me in… what is wrong with you? Y-you’re crazy! I want out of your stupid game!”

The cat frowned, seeming a little taken aback. “You may leave, but if you do, the bad omens will never be reversed. You’ll be like this… forever,” she warns.

“I don’t care!” Kevin insisted, all of his fear and humiliation turning into rage. “I’d rather be like this then put up with you for one more turn!”

“You’re fine being this… size? Someone might accidentally step on you, or-”

“That’s better than getting sat on, or swallowed!” He was so angry and passionate, tears ran down his cheeks as he screamed. You’d never seen him be so… assertive. “Besides, it’s not the omens doing this; it’s you! You’re the one that gave us these cookies, and you’re the one that made this stupid board game!”

“I’m trying to help you, here,” the woman replied, looking a little offended. “None of this was my doing. Your fate was decided by the fates themselves; and if you give up now, then your fate is to be doomed.”

“You’re crazy! Why should I believe anything you say, anyway?” Kevin said, dismissively turning away from her, seeing she wouldn’t listen to reason. “C’mon, guys! Let’s get out of here!” He insisted, looking to the two of you for approval, only to see you staring at him blankly. “Guys? I said let’s go!” There was a long silence, as if he couldn’t understand why you weren’t taking his side on this. Even you needing some time to get your thoughts in order.

“Kevin… look around. Don’t you see how tiny we are? I mean, we can’t even make it off this table on our own,” Maria frowned, trying to gently break the grim truth of the situation; you really didn’t have a choice. “How could we ever live our lives like… this?”

“Yeah. I say, any risk we have to take is worth it,” you nod in agreement, “and this cat lady seems like the only person that might know how to cure us. So… I think we should do what she says.” Kevin seemed shocked that his only two friends in the world weren’t siding with him. In shock, he looks back and forth at the two of you, and then up at the feline, trying to make sense of all this.

“You can drop out of the game personally, if you wish,” she offers, “but note that every player serves as a safety net for the other players. With only two players, your friends… won’t have much of a chance.”

Kevin seemed overwhelmed with despair by his situation. He was faced with two intolerable options; either he continue this abominable ‘game’, or he abandon his friends. It was near impossible for him to make a choice like that. You decided to help him out somewhat. “Listen, Kevin,” you say, trying to calm him down. “Just let me take my turn, and we’ll see what happens. Okay?”

Overwhelmed, he covered his face with his hands, crying to himself. “... okay…” He quietly whimpered, and the cat handed you the dice once again. You tried to look confident as you tossed the dice; after all, all you had to do was not roll a 4. The odds were in your favor.

You closed your eyes, and rolled…
11113211.title: Rescued!

choices: Random Chance
Random Chance
111132111.content:
Kevin flinched as he heard the dice colliding with the table, as if conditioned to think that sound would be followed by some horrible fate being inflicted on him or his friends. You yourself were a little nervous up until you saw the result of your roll; five. You sighed in relief, as you jumped forward, from tile to tile, stopping momentarily when you landed on Kevins. “See? Easy. There’s nothing to be afraid of,” you say, patting his shoulder, trying to reassure him as best you could.

“... mhmm…” He said, not even able to bring himself to look at you. You frowned, but hopped forward to your intended tile. You were now on tile 7, Maria was on tile 3, and Kevin was on tile 6. Most of the red tile were spread out enough that you only had a 1/6 or, at worst, a 1/3 chance of landing on a bad omen, which was reassuring. When Kevin was handed the dice, he only had to worry about tile 10… though it was a little concerning to you, as you didn’t actually know exactly what that tile entailed, and you couldn’t read the flavor text from here. Exactly what would poor Kevin’s fate be if he landed there, you wondered? There was no point in speculating, you suppose; Kevin was already making his move.

When the feline placed the dice in front of Kevin, he simply kicked them with all his might, letting out some of his anger. You held your breath as you watched them roll...
111132111.title: Safe

11113212.content:
Maria tossed the die, hoping with all of her might. As it rolled, she thought about her friends trapped, possibly never making it out. However, an even worse thought came to mind. If this cat lady had eaten one of her friends whole, and did something terrible with the other, than what was happening to her brother right now? Even worse, they left him with a tiger of all things. Maria shuddered as she thought about her brother being inside that belly.

The die finally landed, causing the small girl to fall to her knees as she saw what it was: a two. The cat picked her up by the legs and lifted her up to her face. The cat was frowning at the thought of what she was supposed to do.

”Please, there must be some other way.” Maria said. However, the cat shook her head sadly.

”I’m sorry, but there is nothing I can do.” The cat opened her mouth and placed the depressed child in. Maria was tossed around by the giant tongue and covered in saliva before heading down her throat to join with her friend.

Once she landed in the stomach, you crawled over to her and hugged her. You couldn’t see or hear what happened, but Maria’s expression told you everything. The giant belly groaned as you started to feel weak. You and your friends eventually lost concious, falling victim to the bad omens.
11113212.title: Good luck doesn’t appear to exist here

choices: Random Chance
Random Chance
111133.content:
The lady replied, turning back towards you, “You have landed on the sixth tile. Therefore you have landed in the Bog of Eternal Stench and must stay there until it is your turn again.” You weren’t sure how to feel about that. You were fearful of what was going to happen next but curious to know what exactly this board game had in store for you three. You noticed the cat lady was lost in thought for a moment, her long black tail swayed side to side as she pondered, “Hmmm, well it’s not the worst thing. But it still won’t be pleasant.” Before you knew it you felt the cat’s claws pinch at the back of your shirt. She gently lifted you up off the table and moved you around.

At your small stature the cat lady’s movements were too fast for you, everything became a blur. Soon you slowed down and saw two large, round black-furred mountains in front of you… and they were getting closer. You soon realized that the aforementioned ‘Bog of Eternal Stench’ was referring to her butt crack. You swatted at the cat’s fingers, “Let me go. I don’t wanna go in there. I’ll do anything, just don’t put me in your butt.”

The lady groaned in annoyance, “You want to grow back to normal, don’t you boy!? You three play and finish this game whether you like or don’t like. Those are the rules after all. Now, in you go.” You continued to struggle but the lady had a vice-like grip on you. Soon enough you were brought before her massive butt. Now you know why it was referred to as the ‘Bog of Eternal Stench’, it smelt like hot manure mixed with raw sewage on a hot summer day. You nearly felt like puking and you weren’t even trapped yet.

Although your friends couldn’t smell the horrid stenches you were they could tell you certainly weren’t having a good time. Maria shouted to you, “Don’t worry. I promise we’ll get you out of there.”

You only felt so relieved as you were pressed between the stinky cheeks of the giant feline. The sweaty, furry flesh enveloped you on all sides. The clawed hand retreated out of the crevice behind you. You squirmed and kicked and punched with vigor but it had no impact on the jiggly butt-flesh that entrapped you. You whimpered, about to cry about your situation before you got filled with energy and anger again, you beat against the butt cheeks as they ensnared you, “Let me go you overgrown housecat!”

Despite all of your thrashing about the most of a response you got was the cat lady clenching her furry, sweaty cheeks around you, “Enough squirming boy. Or I keep you in there for two turns. I don’t like this anymore than you, now sit back and behave!” You had a hard time believing she had even an inkling of an idea of how nasty it was for you to be in here. Then, you heard a noise that made your blood run cold. You heard a rumble from deep within the cat’s bowels.

Your eyes widened, “Oh no.” Oh no, indeed. In no time a hot burst of wind blew past you, PPRRFFTTTT! The disgusting stench of cat farts invaded the fleshy crevice that entrapped you. Your eyes watered and your nostrils burned as you continued to squirm, eventually being assaulted by blast after blast of feline flatulence.

Meanwhile, outside of the cat’s bulbous booty she gave her butt a slap, “Settle down now you.” PRRFFFBBBTTTT! The massive lady turned back to eye Maria and Kevin. She knelt down and prodded Kevin with a finger, “You! You must go. Hurry!”

After seeing what she had done to punish you, both of your friends were terrified that a similar or even worse fate would befall them. Kevin was on the verge of tears, “B-but I don’t wanna.” The cat continued to prod him in the back, pushing him closer and closer to the board and his respective die.

The cat stated sternly, “You will play the game or stay like this forever.” This made Kevin even more frightened and shake like a leaf on top of the board game.

Maria shouted out to him, “Be brave Kevin. You can do it.” Kevin muttered to himself in fear as he picked up the comparatively large die and rolled it onto the board. In fear he yelped and covered his eyes with his hands, not wanting to see the outcome. Maria and the cat lady both gasped.

Kevin squeaked, “Did I do it? Is something bad gonna happen?”
111133.title: Bog of Eternal Stench

choices: You’re gonna end up as this black cat’s Halloween treat
You’ll serve as this gassy feline's butt cushion
She uses magic to make her B.O. extra potent
1112.content:
You three chew and munch on your cookies. They weren’t half bad… at least you didn’t think so. You turned to Kevin and Maria and noticed they seemed to be enjoying the cookies as well. You turned back to the black cat lady, finishing off your cookie. You were about to thank her for the delicious cookies, maybe even ask for a few more cookies, but you stopped yourself. You felt strange and tired all of a sudden. Your limbs felt as if they were made of concrete and your eyes became heavy. Instead of thanking the cat lady you let out a yawn.

You whirled around to notice Kevin and Maria in a similar state. There must’ve been something wrong with those cookies! Your hearing started sounding weird, the pitch of the crickets sounded deep and bassy, the crunching of Fall leaves sounded like explosions. Your vision became blurry and distorted. You were so tired, you laid down on the ground and almost immediately fell asleep as your head situated itself on the cat ladies concrete front stoop. Maria and Kevin followed suit.

The black cat lady smiled widely at the three sleeping trick-or-treaters, clapping her paws together and licking her lips, “Ah, wonderful, yes! Mother’s old recipe for Enchanted Sleeping Cookies worked.” The domesticated feline put her paws on her hips and wore a smug smirk as she looked down at you three, “Now you must pay for your bad omens.” You three were soon dragged into the cat ladies’ dark house as the door was eventually closed once again, sealing you all inside with her

You weren’t sure how much time has passed when you reawaken. In reality, you three were only unconscious for ten minutes, but to you it felt like you slept for days. As you open your eyes you notice you’re sat on a large couch in a well-lit living room. The place was nicely furnished with a black wood coffee table in front of you with a vase of deep purple flowers. In front of you was a large flat-screen television and hung on the wall above that was a painting. You gasped as you noticed the painting was of a nude black cat woman. You were in the black cat’s house!

After gasping you could hear the cat’s voice a few rooms away, “Oh! Trick-or-treaters awake again.” You then heard the click-clack of her paw-ed feet on the wooden floor as she approached the living room. You try to get up and sprint out of here before you notice your arms and legs have been bound with rope, a strange rope that had a faint green glow to it. You then notice Kevin and Maria were situated on the couch next to you, both starting to awaken. Click-clack-clack! The black cat entered the living room with a smile on her muzzle.

“Ah yes! My trick-or-treaters are awake. Now I must punish you three for bad omens.” Upon the mention of ‘bad omens’ her ears flattened and her feline eyes narrowed at you. Was she really that mad that you stepped under her ladder? The cat continued as she approached you, “Since I am the local omen mage I must administer your bad omens myself.”

You had no idea what an Omen Mage was and even less of an idea why this cat was trying to punish you and your friends, but you did certainly know that you wanted to get out of here. You pull and tug at your bindings but you can’t break them, in fact, they feel like they’re getting tighter. By now Maria and Kevin have both fully woken up and both were startled at the situation. They tugged at their bindings, receiving a similar tightening effect.

Maria grunted and whined as she writhed on the couch, “Mmmmmfff, what’s going on? Let us go.”

Kevin whined and whimpered, kicking and grunting but getting himself nowhere, “Aw man, I told you guys this was bad news. I knew it, I knew it!”

This only further grated on Maria’s nerves, “Oh, will you give it a rest Kevin?”

Kevin looked red in the face and said in a scared but slightly annoyed voice, “I’m not gonna be quiet Maria, you two were the one’s that dragged us into this and-“

The black cat growled and yelled, “Silence you three! You are breaking my concentration. I must now administer your bad omen.”

You squeak in fear and try to talk your way out of this, still believing this is just a lady in a costume. Probably just playing a mean, yet elaborate prank. “Listen miss, we’re sorry that we broke the rules and walked under your ladder, but can we please just go. We promise to never cause any bad omens ever again.”

Maria barged in with her own comment, “Yeah! And if you don’t let us go the cops will come looking for us. Don’t think you’d wanna deal with them. Vampyre Lane is just a few blocks from the local police station after all.”

The black cat seemed to be listening intently, closed her eyes and responded, “I dearly apologize for what I must do, but it is the law of Vampyre Lane that I perform any and all bad omens that befall trick-or-treaters. Now if you’ll excuse me, the sooner I can perform your omen, the sooner this will end.”

The cat’s mind seemed to be made up as she loomed over you three before Maria interrupted again, “Oh yeah. So what are you gonna do then?” The cat raised a confused furry brow before answering with a rumbling stomach…
1112.title: Omen Punishment

choices: You feel compelled to go inside and get more cookies
You decide to head to the next house
You feel the cat ladies paw tightly grab your wrist
1113.content:
You’re a bit taken aback by the cat ladies hurry for you three to eat her cookies. You look back at her, seeing her expecting look. You stare back at the strange chocolate chip cookie and decide to take a bite out of it. It tastes pretty good. You turn back to Kevin and Maria who have followed suit and taken a bite. They both seem to be enjoying their cookies as well. Looks like you were freaking out for nothing. Sure this cat lady did act a bit strange but she did seem to be from out of the country. She was probably just getting used to the local customs.

Speaking of the cat lady, you look back up at her to see her smirking with a raised brow, “See! I tell you. My cookies are very tasty!” You three nod in agreement as you finish off your cookies, the air of suspicion dissipating around you. You were much less afraid now. You half expected to find something nasty or evil in the cookies like a witches curse or boogers, but these cookies were actually super delicious. These were even better than the homemade ones your mom makes. You didn’t want to sound too greedy, but you wanted to ask for more. They were just so good.

The cat lady waved goodbye to you three and turned her back to you, giving you a good view of her behind. Each butt cheek was the size of a pumpkin, and a pretty massive pumpkin at that. But you felt strange… wrong, almost. You needed more of those cookies! You couldn’t stop at just one. They were too delicious. They were the best things you’ve ever tasted. As the door started to creak shut you yelped, “Wait!”

The cat paused and then opened the door up again, turning back to face you with a questioning look, “Yes! What is it?”

You replied, a bit nervous, “Uh… miss? Could we have some more of your cookies? Please?”

Kevin, who was also nervous, but for a very different reason retorted, “Um… actually that won’t be a problem miss, we have a lot more houses to go to.”

Maria grimaced at Kevin, “Don’t be such a scaredy cat Kevin.”

Kevin complained, “I’m not!”

She grinned widely, knowing that her enchanted cookies had taken affect. Her smile gives you a good view of her pointy feline teeth as her tail happily swayed back and forth behind her, “Well, it sounds like I have fans of my cookies. I do have many more cookies, tons. Just follow me and I’ll give you a whole batch.” At this point your mouth waters, the promise of more of those delicious pieces of chocolatey heaven tantalizes you. Little did you know that this cat lady was a witch. The black cat gestures you to come inside. Should you continue inside for a feast of cookies or continue onward with your trick-or-treating?
1113.title: Hypno-Cookies

choices: Thank her for the map and leave to continue trick or treating
You decide to stay at the Hyena's house and wait for the party to start
You're interrupted by a serious of strange noises
112.content:
You three decided to head towards the Graveyard House. As you opened up a rusty, creaking gate you were met with a myriad of cheesy Halloween decorations. Each side of the lawn had perfectly symmetrically cut grass and goofy props that probably only cost a total of a hundred bucks at the local Target. There were plastic skeletons and ghosts hanging off the house’s drain pipe; plastic monster hands ‘clawing’ at the ground, Styrofoam headstones that read things like ‘Here lies Dumbie Jones’, and tufts of fog rolled out from a fog machine who’s power button light could easily be seen from behind a bush.

As you and your friends walked up the cobblestone path to the expensive house’s porch you turned to Maria and Kevin, commenting, “For a huge house in a rich neighborhood this person really went for the budget Halloween decorations this year.”

Kevin and Maria giggled a bit with you as you walked up to the door, knocking on it and waiting for the person inside to answer. You were in higher spirits now. That tiger lady surely was just a fluke, just someone who was really into Halloween. You bet this next person is in some cheesy witch costume, or a zombie covered in dollar store blood and make-up. You wait out there in silence in the cold October night until you finally hear heavy footsteps rushing their way to the door.

Then you hear muffled cackles and evil laughter coming from behind the door, obviously fake and badly acted, “Who dares comes to my haunted abode? They will surely meet an untimely demise.”

The door creaks open and you needed to hold back your surprise when you were met with yet another person costumed as an anthropomorphic animal. This time the costume in question was that of a hyena woman. She had very shaggy, grey, messy fur, giving her an almost energetic and playful aura. Similar to the tiger lady, she was roughly seven feet tall, and wore very little clothing, this time opting for only a thin, silky black cloak to conceal her nakedness. But you couldn’t shake just how life-like her fur looked? Did they use real animal fur for these costumes? Even more concerning was her muzzle. Her black, canine nose didn’t look plastic at all, and instead had the same wet consistency that a living, breathing canine’s would. You saw the nostrils even flare up, like she was sniffing you. You noticed how her teeth and tongue didn’t look one-bit rubbery, and instead looked wet and natural.

The hyena woman smiled ear to ear when she noticed you three. A smile that would be much more comforting if it wasn’t worn by a sharp-toothed predator. She looked incredibly youthful… as far as you could tell. He facial structure and bodily features made her look like a twenty-something. The hyena woman also wore very wide hips and curvy thighs, with a sizeable bust the size of basketballs. The tall costumed woman knelt down so she was eye-level with you three.

She cooed, “Aw, looks like I got the three cutest little trick-or-treaters at my door. I bet you’re looking for some candy, well good news… I got tons!” The hyena stood back up and shuffled over, seeming to be grabbing large paw-fulls of candy off to the side of the door. She returned back into view with huge quantities of Hershey bars, Mike and Ikes and bags of Candy Corn. She dumped loads of the delicious treats in each of your bags. Once she was done she smirked at you three and cocked her head to the side and poked her cheek with a claw. She stared at you three as if contemplating something.

You look her up and down with suspicion before awkwardly starting, “Um… thanks… so I guess… we’ll just go now.”

You three turn around and start to head out before you hear the hyena woman yell, “Wait, don’t you wanna stay for a while?”

This made Kevin more uneasy, he whispered to you, “Let’s go. This ladies’ creepy. Can we just go home now?”

You then heard the hyena yell out again, “I have a map if you’d like.”

That made you perk up. If you had a map that means you’d know where everything in Vampyre Lane is. You could find the biggest houses and get the most candy. It was the perfect plan. You spun back around, much to Kevin’s distain, “Wait. No. Don’t close the door.”

The hyena lady, who’s back was turned to you, spun back around with a grin on her black, rubbery canine lips. She raised an eyebrow, “Oh, so now you guys wanna come inside, huh?”

You nodded, beaming up at her big pleading, puppy eyes, “Please? We just want a fun Halloween.”

The hyena put her paws on her hips and looked down at you with narrowed eyes and a questioning expression. She soon broke her act and cackled loudly, clapping her paws together, “Alright, come on in.” She waved her paw for you three to enter. She knelt down when you were about to pass her and playfully pinched your cheek, “I could never say no to an adorable pirate like you.”

She stood back up, closing the fancy, carved, wooden door and moving deeper into her well-lit house. The interior of the house, much like the outside was nice and lavish. The hyena woman had polished wood floors, pink paint on the walls and various expensive paintings hanging on them, most of anthropomorphic animals. What was up with this town’s obsession with animals? You followed the hyena into her kitchen where she rummaged through a few cupboards. You noticed there was a DJ set-up, a drink and snack table and a large television in the living room playing scary movies.

Maria noticed this as well, turning to the hyena lady who had her back to you three, and asked, “Miss… what’s that?”

The hyena twisted her head back around, seeing that you three were eying her living room. She chuckled, pulling a large piece of paper out of the cupboard, “Oh, that? It’s for my party tonight. Whole town’s gonna be here. If you’re looking to meet the townsfolk of Vampyre Lane, this is the place to do it. There’ll be party games, scary movies, snacks, the whole nine yards. Ever since college I’ve always thrown the coolest parties.” She smirked, remembering her glory days in Vampyre University, batting the rolled up piece of paper in her paw. She soon snapped out of it, shaking her head, “But anyways, here’s the map.” She handed it over to Maria, “Of course, if you’d like to stay for the party, you’re welcome to hang out here before it starts. If you’re looking for candy there’ll be tons of it here too.” What do you do?
112.title: Spooky Graveyard House

choices: You all go in
You decline her offer
You go in yourself
113.content:
The next point of interest was a strange house. It almost looked like it was made of gingerbread. You saw gingerbread walls, with holes where the windows should be, what looked like frosting holding the bits of house together, and similar frosting decorations adorning the rest of the house.

"Woah, this guy went all out," you whistled. You hoped they didn't spend all of their candy money on decorations. The three of you approached, and the closer you got, the more you smelled gingerbread.

"They wasted no cent on decoration," Maria said.

"Let's just hope they spent as much on the candy," Kevin said, an air of worry in his voice. You three soon reached the front door, and steeled yourself for whatever may be on the other side. Then again, it was probably a clichéd witch costume, seeing the gingerbread theme. You knocked, and the three f you held open your bags. Soon, the chocolate bar looking door opened up, and the owner of the house didn't look like anything you expected.

This person owned another animal suit, this time resembling a goat. However, this goat was wearing an apron. Just an apron. You thought you might've miss-seen it at first, but, sure enough, you saw her frilly, pink apron, but no signs of pants, tank top, not even underwear.
