124.content:
“Let’s go to that one.” Ben said pointing to the house. You look over and nod.

“Looks like a good one.” You said. The three of you enter the yard. There are quite a few bones in the yard. You even saw a cracked skull looking at you, making you shudder. The three of you step up to the porch and ring the doorbell. Within a few seconds, a woman opens the door.

Her lioness costume stunned you. The only visible clothing she had on was panties and a bra. Her entire body looked to be covered in fur, and her tail was actually moving like a real one. Her claws and her eyes looked incredibly sharp, and it felt like her eyes were staring into your soul.

“Trick or treat!” Emma happily said. The woman smiled and handed her and Ben each a large piece of candy.

“My apologies. I need to get some more candy from the kitchen. Would you like to come inside while you wait? My husband isn’t home right now, you it’s just me.” She responded.

You weren’t entirely sure if you should. Something about this woman was off. However, you really wanted candy. After a minute…
124.title: Not enough candy by the door

choices: Halloween House
Creepy Mansion
Ominous Home
Comforting Deanery
Walk down the street
13.content:
Vampyre lane was a myth. At least, it was supposed to be.

SLAM!

Your heart leaped out of your chest as you heard a massive steel gate slam shut behind you. Startled beyond belief, you let out the girliest scream you can possibly muster, only to turn around and see your bratty little brother and his friends laughing at you from the other side. You stomp your foot as you calm down, adrenaline still rushing through your veins. “Aw? Did somebody close the gate?” Your brother almost keeled over laughing at the girly scream you had just unleashed.

“Ooo! Maybe it was the ghooost of Vampyre Laaane!” One of his friends teased, waving his arms around in a ‘ghostly’ manner.

You roll your eyes. “Very funny, guys,” you groan, trying not to give them the satisfaction of seeing you get angry. You grabbed the gate they had closed behind you, trying to push it open, only to realize it won’t budge. “What? This thing’s locked…”

“Hmm! How weird!” Your brother taunted, pointed at a latch on the far side of the gate. “It’s almost as if the latch is only on one side…”

“Well, if you’re stuck in there…” Another of his friends said. “It looks like we’re on our own from now on!”

“This isn’t funny!” You started rattling the gates, realizing what they were planning. “C’mon, it’s getting late! You aren’t supposed to be outside after dark!”

“Well, maybe we don’t want to go to bed! Maybe we want to go trick-or-treating all night long!”

“Is that seriously what this is about?” You say, starting to panic. Something about ‘Vampyre Lane’ was ominous enough; being stuck there was even worse. “Listen, we can talk about this. Compromise! Just let me out! There’s… barbed wire on this thing, for goodness sake!”

“Aww, what’s the matter? Are you scared?” One of the young boys laughed and pointed, noticing the panic in your voice.

“Y’know, maybe we will let you out…” Your little brother cross his arms with a smirk. “For a full bucket of candy!” The rest of his friends all laughed uproariously at his offer, and your heart sunk. Before you could respond, they were all chanting in unison, “Bucketful of candy! Bucketful of candy!” They emptied the biggest of the orange plastic buckets they had into their other bags, before tossing it over the fence. You wince as the bucket clatters loudly against the street. You tiptoed nervously over to pick the bucket up, before turning around to see the boys skipped happily back down the street. “Y’better have our candy by the time we get back, or you’ll be sorry!” Mom is gonna kill me, you think to yourself as you watch the kids you were supposed to be chaperoning run off.

Soon, you were alone… and the silence began settling in. You clutched yourself, nervously, as you looked around. You felt like you were being watched. Halloween was supposed to be scary, of course, but something about this neighborhood was… genuinely creepy. You should’ve followed your mother's advice and stuck to your own neighborhood; never should’ve let your bratty brother trick you into coming here. This place, ‘Vampyre Lane’, seemed to be a fenced off stretch of woods with a crumbling road running in a straight line through the middle. Houses were dotted irregularly along the road, as you would expect, but these houses looked… ancient. If the lights weren’t on inside, you would assume they were abandoned.

You take a moment to calm yourself down. It was getting late, and the darkness was just making you paranoid. Once you met the undoubtedly nice people that lived along this road, they would surely put your fears to rest. You glanced down at your bucket, and figured you could probably fill it up with about a dozen stops. You were a little old to be trick-or-treating, but surely when you explained your situation, they would understand.

The houses unnerved you, somewhat, although you tried to push your fears aside. The first was an average suburban house, covered in an elaborate display of halloween decorations  . There seemed to be some kind of party happening inside; you could hear ‘monster mash’ playing faintly within. This seemed like it’d be the most normal house on the street. Just a little further than that was a two-story mansion that looked abandoned  . There were no lights on inside, and the windows and roof looked busted and ruined… however, there was a sign outside assuring that the house is open to trick-or-treaters, and you thought you could even occasionally see someone looking at you from one of the windows. This skeeved you out, but the smaller house on the other side wasn’t much better. This one looked completely normal, but… something about it was extremely ominous to you. Maybe your mind was just playing tricks on you. Further down, there seemed to be some kind of small deanery covered in religious symbology . It was similarly dark and abandoned, but something about it was oddly comforting, as it was trying to lure you inside

You were paralyzed with nervousness, but you couldn’t wait all night. You had to make a choice. The first house was the obvious (and canon) place to start, but you could skip ahead, if you want...
13.title: Trapped!

choices: A group of crack heads and bums
A serial killer
A schizophrenic
132.content:
You decide to go up to the first house on your left. To your surprise, there weren't any Halloween decorations, save for an ordinary pumpkin. Not carved or anything! However, on closer look, the house didn't need any, because it was scary enough already! Cracked boards for walls, all crooked! There was what appeared to be an actual bat nest in the branches of a perpetually shadowy tree, and the whole house just seemed to exude foreboding.

Taking a deep gulp, you summoned the courage to mount the crickety planks to the house, and ring the bell.

Who or what answers?
132.title: Creepy Mansion

choices: You go inside
You stay outside
You decline the offer
1321.content:
You pressed the bell.
For a few seconds, you heard nothing, wondering if the place was actually inhabited despite this strange feeling to be observed.
But when you are about to turn around and move to the next house, you're hearing some footsteps approaching and the creaking door opening. The person who opened looked like nothing mentioned by the rumors, a simple human being such like you. This one was indeed pretty hairy with a large beard, long black hairs and according to the smell, it sounds that the origins of the rumors were more simple than you expected : a bunch of homeless people.

You breath out deeply, pleased to discover that Vampyre Lane was, like most of urban legends, a simple case with an exaggeration of facts. The man is staring at you with a face reflecting some kind of curiosity.

"-Yeah Bud'? Can I know why you're here? You're looking unwell..." he asked.
"-Sorry." you said "I came here and got trapped by a bunch of little brats who locked me here in exchange of candies...but unless you know another way out, I guess I'm going to another place..."
You are about to leave but at the moment you turned around, the old man shout "-Wait! Where are you going?"
You stopped. "-I'm going to find some candies or another exit as I told you..."
"-What time is it?"
"-It's 9:50pm" you answered looking at your watch after a sight "Can I leave now? I want to go home..."
"-You won't leave this place like this and It's a very short time... hopefully it's not too late..."
The bum turned around in hurry, facing someone in the house "Hugo?" He asked "Is it possible to add someone in ten minutes?"

You heard an answer from the inside but it was too far from your position to understand what was said, but you can see the face of the man filled with disappointment.
"-What the heck is going on? Will you tell me what's wrong in here?!" you shout.
"-I'm sorry pal, there's nothing we can do... We're too close to the deadline..."
"-What deadline? Tell me?"
"-In normal days, this place is dead and peaceful... soon it will be filled with life. I bet you already saw some decorations and glowing eyes around you..."
"-You mean the party in the neighborhood? It's normal on Halloween Night... What are you trying to tell me?"
"-I'm sorry, It's too late... we cannot help you. They're coming.... Good luck and don't trust anybody!"
"--They-- ? Hey!"

The bum slam the door at you and said a few words, "The statue nearby the shack.", before getting completely quiet.

"Sir?" you're asking in front of the door "Sir...?"
You knock the door but you got no further answers, the man and his band were like vanished from the world and after a few minutes you heard a loud deep sound coming from the church.

1... 2... 3... The bell is ringing 8... 9...10 o'clock for you.
You are confused, Stunned by the sound, giving you a short headache and then nothing... nothing but one difference...
The sound around you... so quiet and peaceful before, now sounding louder, warmer... and now you are slowly back to yourself, you notice that silence has died, and the city has came to life...

You look around you and see a city filled with light, louder musics and even... voices?
All of this sounded so strange that you finally thought you just got crazy a few time with all these rumors about the place... maybe you even imagined the bums since when you gave another look at the mansion, you saw some light from the inside and no more eyes looking at you through the window...

You take a new breath and retry ringing the bell of the mansion. At worst, you're going to see these people again! After all, nobody can disappear like this. This time, you hear another kind of footstep, softer, lighter and faster. Someone opened the door...
You almost dropped your orange bucket when you saw the person... A very realistic costume shaped like a black wolf with red-orange eyes.

"I... I... Excuse me... Guess I rang at the wrong door..." You said with a forced smile, stepping slowly backward.
"-Well, I don't see any problem with this. Such things happen... or maybe you are here for another reason? I know, the house looks creepy but it's a style to afraid and amuse the kids. If such a great person needs something, feel free to ask..."
The voice sounds calm and the tons let you think that the person was a probably a woman in disguise... despite the fact the costume seems to be very detailed, even producing the eye blinking effect.

Since the wolf woman seems to be friendly to your person, you decide to relax. Scratching the back of your head and explaining the facts.
"So you need to bring to your friend some candies in order to leave, right?"
"-Yes... and as quick as possible, I would like to go home before dawn or else, my mother is going to kill me..."
"-Well, for a cute boy like you, I think I can do something... how old are, you by the way?"
"-I'm nineteen years old... I know, it's a bit too late for trick-or-treating people..."
"-Yes. Actually, I use to play some games with kids in order to decide their prize but I guess you're too... strong for this. I think I'm going to give them to you for free. Since it's in my cellar, I'll spend some time searching for it and I don't want you to stay outside with this cold so... please, come in, grab a chair and wait. It won't be long, I promise! I've got some coffee if needed."

You are wondering if it's a good idea to come in since you don't know the person. On the other hand, you are a young man but an adult, what could go wrong?
1321.title: It's starting now

choices: It comes from the ceiling...
It comes from the next room...
It comes from the entrance...
13211.content:
You keep in mind what the bum told you but all of this seems too strange that you finally convince yourself that you just hallucinated because of all this fear. Of course, you are not about to forget the rumors saying that people who came to Vampyre Lane disappeared but this person looks like a normal person and don't seems aggressive.

You are entering, still looking at her very detailed costume... how much time and money did she spent on it? At least, you can say it, it was a very well done job, all these details could deceive anyone who could think she was a real monster...

The host led you in a living room near the entrance. The inside looks more modern and clearly less damaged than outside. You cross the old wooden creaky corridor and sit down on a chair she presents to you while a machine is preparing some coffee.
You thank her for being such generous but you could not remove your eyes from her body. At a moment, she noticed while filling a cup with coffee.

"-You look fascinated by me... First time you saw someone in disguise?"
"-I must say that it's the first time I so such detailed costume... you did a good job!"
"-Ho, I see... Well thanks but it was not that hard to make it, trust me... maybe soon you'll know my secret..."
"-Nah, no needs to spoil the surprise. But it's true that such costume fit your body so much that I would like to see your real face and how you're removing it. It looks like if it was sticked to you body! Haha!"

The wolf didn't reacted to your joke. Maybe it wasn't that funny than you thought? Or maybe she's ashamed by her real body?
You will maybe never know but for sure, it has made an awkward silence, a silence she broke only a few seconds later when she put your coffee on the table.

"-Thank you... Really, If I did say something wrong... I want you to know that I..."
"-No, it's okay!" She interrupted you with a grin. "Well, I'll go to the cellar as promised to bring you the candies of freedom! Please, hold on, stay here and don't touch anything. Can I trust you?"
"-Sure!" you say.

The woman left you all alone in the living room with your coffee you just started to drink. It was not the best coffee but it was a good one... hot, not too long, not too short, a perfect one to stay awake for all the night. Your little brother got to be ready because it's gonna kick some butt soon or later... Especially if your host bring you enough candies.

While you were waiting for her, you are looking around. She got a lot of shelves with plates and glasses but for some reasons, there no photos, no paintings showing people or even a tapestry... but such a place looks so old that It should have some pictures! It was almost like if she didn't wanted her visitors to know her true face...
Maybe, you were right and she was just considering herself as too ugly to be shown on a photo!

You are waiting. And it sounds like she was gone for an eternity... You decided to stand up and walk to the direction she took in order to reach the mentioned cellar. You reach a new room, a great hall with a huge table on the middle. You are not an expert in matter of houses and rooms but it was definitely a dinning room... and it windows are blocked with iron bars... what a strange house!
But since you're not living here, you don't know about the potential criminality. Perhaps Vampyre Lane got some burglars?

You are visiting the place, calling your host "Hello? Madam! Where are you? I'm still waiting!"
But you heard nothing. You called a second time "Madam?!".

A few steps later wondering if she got something, you heard a huge sound of wood echoing around you.
"What was that?"
13211.title: A long time to wait

choices: You want to stay in the mansion for the night.
You know a group of kids you could bring to the mansion.
You attempt a fight.
132111.content:
The sound came from the ceiling, you are sure of it... Of course, it's not fair and legal to explore place you don't belong to, but such a noise wasn't something to ignore. At worst, you're going to find out it was nothing and just go down, expressing apologies if she comes back in the meantime. Then you go upstairs, walking through more corridors until you reached the room above the dining hall.
You open the door slowly. You give a quick look around to check if there is no dangers in the room.

There is nothing, it's just a simple bedroom with obviously a bed, some bookshelves, a desk and a closet.
Recovering your calm, you thought it was nothing or once again, your imagination but at the moment you were about to leave the room, something on the desk catch your eyes... something looking like a picture.

You move slowly to the desk, steps after steps, you approach. You took the photo in your hands and saw an astonished scene...
The wolf girl was on it with still her costume and surrounded by other people wearing several different but similar costumes in matter of details. But you are even more shocked when you realized that another photo nearby show other peoples... wearing these costumes as well... What was the secret about it?

You pulled a few drawers... and more photo and this time, even more surprising... a photo of the girl when she was a child...
Still the same tail, same eyes, same hairs, same fangs but smaller... What was the point with all of this? Are these costumes special? Or maybe... No It cannot be possible... These people are not wearing costumes at all, this is their real body. Something that would explain everything about the behavior of your host...

Are they some kind of creatures hiding there? But what is the point if they are doing anything to convince you to join them? What are their plans? And moreover, since the rumors are starting to be confirmed... what happened to those who lost their way in Vampyre Lane?

It was not time anymore to think, you have to flee. You have to escape and warn your brother, no matter if you have to mutilate yourself with the barbed-wire, this is not a place for you... But at the moment you closed the drawers in fear, you hear a sound coming from the closet... like if something was inside.
You moved slowly to it... you put your hand on the handle, ready to unlock and open the door... You take a deep breath and open it quickly. A corpse has fallen... and he was still alive. An eight-year-old boy tied up with tape on his mouth.
It was definitely worse than you thought!

You were shocked and spooked but you quickly tried to calm the boy down, thinking about the consequences if the wolf come back. "Hush, hush, lad... I'm here, It's over... It's over... Calm down.. It's going to be okay..."
Relaxing the boy was hard but you had to do your best even if you can bet this one had some bad times... At the moment you freed him, he said : "They wolfed them all... all of them... She kept me for the final..."
"-Calm down.. I'm here now..." You said while giving him a hug to help him to calm down... "Listen, I know you get through a terrible nightmare, but we are still not saved. We will try to get out of here, but you need to trust me and above all, keep calm... Okay?"

The child nodded. "Fine, I'm going forward and you'll follow me."
You had absolutely no idea how to get out... but the bum you think you've met told you about some statue... If it wasn't an illusion, there should be something useful there. You hoped to find out something like a weapon, or something to defend yourself until you reach the exit. For sure, you two have to leave in a way or another...

For sure, the chances she had candies were finally low... and she certainly had other plans in mind... Maybe some poison or something similar to knock you out? You don't want to know.

You are now going down, always giving signs to the kid when he can follow.
Once you reach the dining hall, problems were incoming... You saw an handle turning.
You had the time to quickly move your arms to order the child to hide, and facing the incoming person.

"Ho! You're there! hehe..." you stepped backward while talking "You were long, I feared that... I dunno, you fell on the stairs or things like that! You know, there are many accident in dark night...ha-ha..." You spoke with a forced smile, having hard time to speak straight. You do your best to hide it but deep inside, you are afraid of her. Now you know what she is...

"No worries" she said "I just had to open crates, I have just a few candies actually, here, take it!" she presents you a small bag of candies with a friendly smile.

"Err... thank you!" You grabbed with an hesitating hand the bag, sliding it into your pocket. "Well... It was all fun and all... but I need more candies to calm down my brother... and the night is short.. looked at the time! Ten minutes past already... It's time to go!"

While you are talking to her, you keep moving backward while she unlike you, move forward. The child you saved manage to sneak being her.

"Well...if you want to go, the entrance is here!" She answers pointing at the door leading to it.
At this moment, you gave a quick look above her shoulder, seeing the kid doing some gesture, warning you to don't do it, then imitating some animal, with claws... and finally, moving his hand like if it was a sandwich...

It was clear, if you come back to the entrance, an ambush will happen and you'll get caught.
You've got to think fast. Of course you could try to attack first and hope it will give some time to the boy so he could escape... but the best would have been to be both saved. What excuse or lies you could choose?
132111.title: Care killed the cat?

choices: Walter
Travis
Doug
Daniel
Jordan
14.content:
“You shouldn’t be hanging out with these boys, Jordan. They’re… not a good influence.”

When your sister asked you supervise her son and his friends while they went trick-or-treating, you thought it was a marvelous idea. Perhaps this would be the perfect opportunity to just wind down, forget your problems and enjoy the fun, ‘spooky’ atmosphere of Halloween. Perhaps you could vicariously relive your childhood memories of dressing up on spooky autumn nights and collecting candy with your long-lost friends. Perhaps you could even get your hands on some candy yourself. Unfortunately, your night hasn’t been particularly relaxing so far. While you expected Jordan’s friends to be rowdy, you didn’t expect this.

You felt like you were being ripped in half trying to keep track of them all. Every time you took your eyes off one of them, they got up to something or another; be it roughhousing, tormenting poor Jordan, or even, at one point, dumping a carton of rotten eggs onto somebody’s windshield. You had to waste an entire half hour of precious Halloween time resolving that one. Jordan was always such a little angel, which is why you were shocked he would keep this sort of company. As their delinquency continued, though, you were starting to piece things together. Jordan definitely didn’t approve of what they were doing, but he was too meek and shy to stop them — they had somehow brainwashed him into believing they were cooler than him or whatever.

Worse still, they seemed to be trying to ditch you to head to some place called Vampyre Lane, supposedly more ‘dangerous’ and ‘real’ than another other neighborhood during Halloween. Well, they could ditch you if they wanted, but you weren’t about to let them bring poor Jordan along. “C’mon. Why don’t we continue trick-or-treating together — just the two of us?” You whispered, kneeling in front of Jordan while his friends were distracted. “They haven’t even let you have any candy, for goodness sake.”

“I’m sorry, tía, but… if I don’t come with them, they won’t want to be my friends anymore,” Jordan frowned, looking guilty but persistent.

“Why should they be your friends? They don’t seem to treat you very kindly.”

“Yeah, but they don’t mean it! They’re just joking around!” Jordan tries to explained. “I-”

“Hey, dickweed! You comin’ or what?” The oldest of the boys, Walter, interrupts. He was sort of the ringleader of the group, and was the one who constantly escalated their bullying. He tried to make himself look older than he was, with a black baseball hat and bomber jacket atop a white undershirt and jeans. He even had the faintest makings of a ‘stache, a fact he frequently boasted about. When he saw you kneeling in front of Jordan, holding your nephew’s shoulder reassuringly, his face twisted into that familiar, unbearably smug grin. “Aww. What’s the matter? You need your precious aunt to take care of you?”

“N-no, I’m coming!” Jordan insists, pushing your arm away and rushing back to his friends. Walter gives you a mean look before he turns away, leading the group towards the so-called Vampyre Lane. He was the one who egged that car when you had glanced away for only a moment; you shudder to think what he would get up to when left to his own devices. You follow stubbornly along behind them as they tread through the forest towards the ‘lane’, although you knew they were going to manage to slip away any second now. You’ve already called each of their parents at least once by now, and none of them care. Boys will be boys, they all say. You were going to have to take care of these delinquents all on your own.

Among their ranks was Travis, Walter’s younger brother and lap dog, who tries his best to get into his sibling’s good graces, and continually fails. There was Daniel, batter for the local junior baseball team and second-in-command of the group. Finally, there was Doug, who continually got into fights at school and loved to roughhouse ‘til somebody’s bleeding. While Jordan was dressed in an adorable werewolf costume, the rest of his friends weren’t dressed up in costumes whatsoever; they were too mature for such a thing, of course. They just cared about the candy and the pranks — the tricks and the treats, you suppose, were the essence of Halloween.

Eventually, you grew bored. Was Vampyre Lane a real place? Were they actually going anywhere, or were they just wasting time? As you followed them down the forested path, your eyes eventually drifted up to the moon. It was a full moon tonight. Fittingly spooky for Halloween. You chuckled at the thought… but continued staring at it. There was something… enchanting about the full moon tonight. It absorbed your focus completely, and soon you could hardly take your eyes off it… at least until you heard bushes swaying all around you. You turned back to the group, only to find that they had disappeared! You hear movement in the bushes as they ran off, as well as Walter’s unbearably smug laughter. They had ditched you! “Damn it!” You groaned. You knew they’d try this, but you were hoping you’d be able to catch ‘em. They were smarter than you gave them credit for.

You huffed as you started walking back through the forest. Let ‘em leave — who cares? If they get up to any trouble now, you weren’t going to be around to bail them out. They weren’t your responsibility anymore. You felt bad for Jordan, but… he needed to learn his lesson, too. You were so wrapped up thinking about your hatred for Jordan’s friends that it took you a few minutes to realize you had no idea where you were going. They had just stranded you in the middle of the woods! The forest here was huge; you could be lost all night! You bury your face in the hands, to muffle the sound of you screaming in anger and frustration. You didn’t care what Jordan said — next time you saw those boys, you’d be giving them a piece of your mind! And you’d be making sure they couldn’t bully your poor nephew any longer!

You take a moment to compose yourself. All you had to do was pick a direction and stick to it. You’d only been walking for 15 minutes; it couldn’t be that hard to find your way back. Your plan seems promising at first, but you eventually realize that, in the darkness, you couldn’t tell if you were travelling in the same direction or not. Your surroundings all blended into itself. It didn’t help that there was something genuinely creepy about travelling through these woods so late at night on Halloween. You shivered a bit, clutching yourself as you venture deeper and deeper into the unknown… until you hear a howl in the distance.

Your blood runs cold. A wolf’s howl. That’s how they communicate with eachother in the wilderness. That must mean there’s a pack nearby. Were they out hunting for something? You knew wolves didn’t usually attack humans, but if they were starving, you would seem like an all-you-can-eat buffet. You try your best to stay calm as you walk at a gradually increasing pace, panic rising in your chest. You hear a second howl — sounding like it was much closer this time — and before you knew it, you were sprinting through the woods at full speed. No matter how fast you run, you can hear the howls growing closer and closer, as if the pack was hot on your tail.

Suddenly, something huge jumps into the path in front of you. You stop dead in your tracks, staring at its silhouette in horror. The creature stood at eight feet tall, towering over you as its glowing yellow eyes pierce through the darkness. As your eyes adjust, you realize it’s some kind of hulking wolf creature, standing up on two beefy legs, with thick grey fur shielding it against the cold October breeze. For a moment, it almost seems friendly, gesturing towards you as if trying to tell you that it’s safe to come closer. The second you take a curious step towards it, though…

“Aaaaaugh!”


… the monster leaps at you, and the last thing you see before you lose consciousness is its sharp fangs ready to wrap around your head…

┄┄┄


While you’re unconscious, you’re… transformed. You’re not human. Not anymore. Now, you’re something else entirely. Eventually, you’re awoken by the sound of someone’s voice...
14.title: Full Moon

choices: Give in to your instincts — humans are prey, now!
Listen to your human side; try to ask him for help.
Can't decide! Just keep hiding and hope he goes away!
142.content:
“Guys? W-where are you?”

The sound of a worried voice calling out through the forest roused you from your deep slumber, feeling yourself lying on your back on the forest floor. Your first surprise came the moment you opened your eyes; all of a sudden, you could see in the dark! The colors were much dimmer, but even in the darkness, you could discern movement with superhuman ease; you could see every single errant twitch of the tree leaves in the breeze, with crystal clarity. As you woke up more and more and sensations returned to your body, you realized everything else was similarly… off. Your sense of hearing and smell were incredible, first of all, but on the downside, your body felt wrong, somehow. Moving around felt weird, as if you were heavier now, and your joints had changed positions.

While you felt covered, you were actually completely naked, your clothes lying in broken scraps all around you. What felt like clothing was actually a thick coat of grey fur that covered every inch of your body, wrapping around you like a wool blanket. Despite the fact you seemed heavier now, you were also much stronger; and after some confusion, you were finally able to sit up. For a moment, you thought the forest had gotten a lot smaller… until you realized you had just gotten a lot bigger! You were about 10 feet tall now, give or take, about twice your original size! You were afraid you might have sustained some brain damage. The reality was much more alarming. You were… some sort of creature! A werewolf, similar to how you’d always imagined one, though with some… unexpected features.

You finally managed to stand up shakily without falling over, and pause for a moment, exploring your new body. In addition to your increased size, your body was just disproportionately more voluptuous now, with breasts each about as large as your human form’s entire head was, thighs so thick you could crush a man’s skull between them, and a belly so pudgy someone could use it as a water bed. Despite your unbalanced increases in size, you were still able to balance yourself easily with your immense strength, though walking was a little difficult at first. You look behind you, noticing you had a long big, fluffy tail partially covering your rounded butt, which wagged involuntarily whenever you were excited. You also noticed your hands now had soft paw pads, and long, sharp claws. Finally, you run your new paws over your face, realizing you now had a long snout with sharp fangs, and big, fluffy ears peeking out of the top of your head.

You were so overwhelmed by these new sensations and emotions, you didn’t quite know how to feel. Quickly, a single sensation dominated your mind… hunger. You had already been feeling a little peckish, but apparently, as your belly grew in size, so did your appetite. You don’t think you’ve ever felt this hungry in your life! You were wondering how you could possibly stop by a restaurant in this state… until you heard that voice again, reminding you that there was someone nearby. Surely enough, you saw movement in the distance with your peripheral vision, and immediately ducked into the bushes just moments before he otherwise would’ve spotted you.

Despite being such a huge, lumbering beast, you were able to become completely silent as you peeked at him from the dark. With your innate night vision, you could clearly see Travis pointing around a flashlight as he trudged through the forest. “C’mon, guys, this isn’t funny!” He calls nervously, trying to find his friends. Apparently, they ditched him too. You got the feeling they didn’t like him that much. “Come back! I-I don’t want to get lost out here!” You felt a pang of sympathy for him… as well as a pang of hunger. As you realized he was in the perfect position for you to pounce, you ran through a furious internal debate in your head, trying to judge how you should treat this situation...

Your human morals and ideals have, for the most part, faded away, replaced with an instinctive sense of survival of the fittest. Travis no longer looked like just another one of Jordan’s annoying friends; he looked like delicious prey, vulnerable and separated from its pack. Your increased size called for larger meals, and he definitely fit the bill. Even your human side partially wanted to get the ultimate form of revenge on him for all the times he’s tormented poor Jordan. On the other hand… you couldn’t just devour a human being, could you? Even though you were a werewolf, people still can’t be treated like food! No matter how satisfying the idea seemed to you on a primitive level, you knew, on a rational level, that it wasn’t the right thing to do. You should just wait for him to pass… or even ask him for help! Surely, he’d understand… right?

All of these options run through your mind in less than a second. It’s not longer before you have to make your final decision...
142.title: Transformed

choices: Walter
Doug
Daniel
1421.content:
You licked your lips involuntarily as you stared at Travis from the bushes. Even though your rational mind insisted it was wrong, every inch of your new body was telling you that it was only natural for wolves to prey upon the weak. Besides, it can’t be considered cannibalism — you’re not human anymore! You’re something different, now. Something more powerful. Something higher on the food chain. Indeed, it would only be the natural way of things for you to just gobble him up. Survival of the fittest; he obviously wasn’t fit enough to survive on his own in the wilderness, so he could at least make himself useful as a tasty treat for an actual, competent survivalist. Indeed, thinking of all the things he’s done to poor Jordan, this was just karma, right? You’ve wanted to get rid of the annoying brat all Halloween… and now you finally had the perfect opportunity.

Your body seemed to move on its own accord, as your instincts led you to assume the perfect position to pounce. You had abandoned all planning or higher thinking, instead relying solely on your wits. You could feel tension rising in your chest as the time to pounce approached, your animal instincts predicting his every movement with almost supernatural clairvoyance. Eventually, he was in range for a pounce, and turned away from you, pointing his flashlight idly into the distance. Your body screamed at you that the perfect time to act was now. There was no turning back at this point… so, with a terrifying growl, you let your muscular hind legs propel you through the air, as you leaped towards him!

He turned around far too late; he only caught a moment’s glimpse of your huge form as you flew towards him, before he found himself pinned to the ground. He froze up like a deer in headlights as you pinned his shoulders against the ground with your powerful paws, staring at the creature on top of him in a mix of awe and terror. He was too shocked to even scream. “W-what are-” He was about to ask, but was interrupted when you sent your long, canine tongue gliding over his face, getting a feel for a human’s flavor. While Travis coughed, his face now covered in saliva, an idea occurs to you. You originally expected to be devouring your meal… messily, but after hearing your belly gurgle once again, your instincts give you another idea. Maybe… you could really fill your belly, after all. Your maw was huge, after all, and you were like twice his size. Would such a thing even be possible? Only one way to find out…

You lick over his face for a while, savoring the unexpected flavor of human, and for a moment Travis believed that the huge wolf-creature atop him was just curious, and meant no harm. This optimist delusion ended the moment you wrapped your jaws around his face, immediately wrapping your tongue around his head, pulling it into your waiting maw. You giggled a bit, his hair unexpectedly tickling the top of your mouth, as you quickly press his forehead against the back of your maw before he could even register what was happening. By the time Travis finally called out, his voice was too muffled by your throat for anyone to possibly hear.

Your throat stretched around his wide shoulders with similar ease, as if you had been biologically designed to devour your prey in such a fashion. For you, there was nothing even remotely uncomfortable about the seemingly difficult process; in fact, it felt natural. Despite the fact that your Halloween ‘treat’ was currently squirming and struggling with all its might beneath you, you felt like you could just take your time and savor this new experience. Despite your mouth being stretched beyond all belief, you managed to smile a little. You imagined just how happy Jordan might be once he learned you got rid of one of those bullies. Sure, he seems to like them for some reason… but once you explain the situation, he’ll surely realize Travis is better belly fat then he is a friend.

Of course, if Jordan did find out what happened here, he would freak out, as anyone would. But that possibility didn’t even strike you, your new species making you so far removed from basic human empathy. You couldn’t see how anyone could possibly find fault with what you were doing, even as you were in the middle of shoving an entire, wriggling human down your esophagus like a savage beast. The only moral code you followed now was the code of the wild — and as you committed acts most humans would find abhorrent, you felt like you were ascending humanity, and becoming one with nature, your true home. Your body accepted your huge meal readily, and you knew this was what mother nature intended for you. You didn’t want to sit around savoring the moment any longer, though. You were eager beyond belief to have Travis curled up in your belly completely…

He was into his elbows, now, and his arms were pinned against his sides, leaving him to kicking futilely. You lifted him up into the air, although you remained on all fours, letting your stretchy throat wrap around him like a snake. It was surprisingly fun to slurp a whole human up like a noodle. You could still breathe just fine even with this huge obstruction in your throat, making your meal even more comfortable. That’s what this felt like to you, really; a meal, just like any other. A particularly squirmy meal, perhaps, but more than tasty enough to make up for that, and fun to eat! You almost made a game out of taking another gulp when Travis least expected it, pulling him deeper just when he thought he was making progress on his escape. Your throat was almost like a hammock for your prey, the bulge swinging back and forth beneath you as he wriggled.

Before you knew it, he up to his knees in your throat, and with a contented snort, you finally felt comfortable standing up on two feet. Standing flipped poor Travis upside down, disorienting his escape attempts; it was also a lot easier to swallow from this angle, too, as gravity assisted with his descent down your throat. These two factors considered, it wasn’t much longer before only his feet remained, wriggling on your tongue as you finally closed your sore jaws. You let him linger there, enjoying the feeling of a lively meal in your throat while it lasted, before finally leaning your head back and taking one big, final swallow. The bully that had so tormented you and your nephew quickly disappeared into your stomach completely, bulging your belly out significantly.

The second your throat was cleared, you looked down at your gut with delight, feeling almost ready to scream with excitement. It was so wonderfully big and round now, and growled with satisfaction as it was finally filled up with a meal. You could feel every move he made in there, and giggled as he wriggled around, imaging your body as a makeshift prison for your captive. You sat down, leaning against a tree as you rubbed all over your belly excitedly with your huge paws, the skin pleasantly sensitive now that it’s so stretched out. This was definitely one of the most fun and pleasant sensations you’d ever experienced. It was almost… maternal, in a morbid way.

You had crossed the moral event horizon, and realized it didn’t really feel all that bad being on the other side. It was actually kind of… exciting. Like you could do whatever you wanted, and nothing could get in your way, not even basic ethics. You had once felt so powerless in society, and now, your will was absolute. The people who used to have authority over you could now just be churned up into fat at your leisure. Your boss, your ex, your landlord… all of them were defenseless against you now. Like you said, you were the new top of the food chain, and anybody’s right to life was now up to your judgement. This is the way things were meant to be — powerful predators asserting their will over helpless prey.

Speaking of fat, you were beaming with excitement at the new layer of pudge your meal would undoubtedly bring you. Travis was pretty scrawny, so you doubt he’d add much to your figure, but surely you’ll have many more ‘meals’ like this in the future. As you sit there, you fantasize about devouring every single human in the small little neighborhood you came from, filling your belly up to the brim. Multiple whole, living people converted into nothing but fat on your new, perfect body… what a thought! In fact, why not start now? You realized that your belly wasn’t even nearly full yet. Sure, Travis made an impressive bulge in your gut, but you’re sure you could make it that bulge an order of magnitude larger until you were finally, unarguably full.

In fact… those other bullies would be the perfect candidates. They’d be much more useful as pudge, anyway, and surely Jordan would applaud you for taking care of his fake ‘friends’ so efficiently. He might even give you a nice, relaxing bellyrub while your big meal gurgled away. Indeed, even when your belly was filled with an entire human, your gluttony still made you hungry for more. You felt light-headed at the thought of having all four of them locked away in there like your prisoners, stretching your stomach to its absolute limit. Your ears perked up as you listened attentively, and sure enough, you could hear them far in the distance, all stomping loudly through the forest and yelling at eachother, making themselves far too easy to track.

Overcome by excitement for the hunt, you lean back and howl into the cool night, the full moon watching over you like a guardian angel. With its guidance, you run off towards one of the noises in the distance, ready to devour your target no matter who they turned out to be. Eventually, you recognized their voice yelling in the distance...
1421.title: One With Nature

choices: Go down Bog Street
Explore Maple Street
Try out Haunted Road
Pull some pranks at the Halloween Party in the park
Split up to cover more ground
15.content:
This was it! This was the night. You’d finally be able to pull off the pranking spree you’ve been planning for months. People at school tend to call you a lot of things: class clown, a prankster, not funny. You certainly were a bit of a goof ball. You carved out quite the reputation for yourself at school as a troublemaker and a jokester. You remember last year when you glued your teacher’s seat, getting her butt trapped in it when she sat down. Or when you let out the biology lab’s snake, Leonard, into the halls. You even recall your very first prank, when you replaced your teacher’s lipstick with a stick of Elmer’s glue that left you out of school for a week. You may not be the most popular in school but you certainly had your group of friends.

Tonight, you would pull some crazy pranks in the notorious Vampyre Lane. Everyone said it was haunted, or from another dimension, and that anyone who stayed there after midnight was trapped in there forever. Of course you didn’t believe those stories. That’s impossible. Vampyre Lane was just a gated community for rich people who wanted to be left alone, so it was clear why the neighborhood was off the beaten path in the local woods and very few people ventured there. You made sure that all your supplies were ready. You had your handy-dandy slingshot, some fresh eggs from the local supermarket, some old fish wrapped in newspaper, dozens of toilet paper rolls, whipped cream, and then some. You were set and well equipped for your night of debauchery.

You pulled out your ninja costume your mom bought. You told her you really wanted to be a ninja this year because you really liked Kung-Fu movies. In reality, the entirely black fabricated costume would blend perfectly into the darkness of the October night. No one would be able to spot you. You just had to be smart and quick on your feet. You left your house as the sun started to set with a trick-or-treat bag in hand. Although, the bag was already filled with all your supplies. You ran down your street and towards the local park, there you met up with your friends, Tori, Blake and Priscilla. They’ve been your best friends since you could remember.

You were all dressed up for Halloween. Your plan was to cause some mischief in Vampyre Lane and then go back to your own neighborhood later that night for the real trick-or-treating. Tori was a bit of a tomboy and enjoyed roughhousing with you and Blake since you first met. There were actually a couple times she’d tackle one of you in football. Tori was dressed as a black cat. Blake was a bit of a nerd; he was incredibly smart but had his own weird sense of humor and mischief to him as well. You two met at a trading card tournament and have been good friends since. Blake was dressed as an army soldier, hoping the costume would blend in with the bushes. Finally, Priscilla was a born prankster herself, she was kicked out of her old school for hiding the school’s lab mice in her principal’s desk. Ever since she was transferred to your school you’ve become good friends. Priscilla was dressed as a swamp monster, her green and sickly brown face paint would vanish in the dark woods without a problem.

You approached the three with a grin, “So, everyone have their supplies?” Everyone held up their own trick-or-treat bags, obviously filled with pranking materials. You nodded, “Great. Let’s go then. Show these rich folks that Halloween isn't all about the treats.” The sun was just barely visible as you four trudged through the local woods. The big orange ball slowly descended behind the horizon, turning the sky a dark blue as stars became visible. Just as it started to get dark out you came upon Vampyre Lane. A huge, black, metal fence surrounded the community and seemed to go on forever on both sides. The fence stood at an imposing ten feet with barbed wire and spikes decorating the top. Written in cursive on the open gates was ‘Vampyre Lane’.

A chill ran up all four of your spines, but you wouldn’t let that deter you. After all, everything inside seemed much more festive. Sounds of chainsaws, ghoulish yelps, monstrous growls, spooky music and trick-or-treaters walking about came from beyond the gate. Tori was the first to march onward, “Come on, scaredy cats, are we doing this or what?”

You, Priscilla and Blake all nod, “Yeah, let’s go,” you say. You three follow Tori into the gated community. Once you four enter and look around you hear a creak behind you and then a metal crash, CLANG! You turn around to see the open gates had just shut themselves.

Priscilla gasped, “What?”

Blake chuckled, “They must be trying to scare us. Good trick.” You four take in the scenery. There were various blocks of large three-story houses with lavish lawns and expensive, sprawling decorations. These people were clearly loaded. So many blocks, so many houses. Where to begin?

Priscilla asked, looking around in awe, “So… where to first?”

Blake chimed in, “I say we do a full street first. Maybe don’t prank every house… they might catch on… but prank a few and then move onto the next street. Make sure they don’t notice us.”

Tori nodded, “Good idea. So which street will it be?”

You noticed a few options. There was once street you noticed called Bog Street. There were large tufts of thick fog rolling down the block. It was dimly lit, with no streetlights and only the lights of the houses decorations to illuminate the street. This street looked to be the scariest. The decorations were gory and bloody, with lots of zombie and demon props. Grave stones littered lawns, robotic zombies clawed out of the ground and grunted, and projections of evil demons swooped and spun around the cobweb-covered houses. All of the lights shining out of the houses were distinctly red, giving the street an eerie glow. However, you noticed on almost every porch there were giant bowls of candy. If you were younger, this street might’ve been too much for you, even now it creeps you out a little.

The next street you saw was called Maple Street. This street had a much warmer tone to it. All of the houses were well lit, and had a nice cottage-theme to them. This block seemed to be heavily frequented by trick-or-treaters and the decorations seemed more silly than intimidating with inflatable witches, grave stones with funny names scrawled on them, and speakers playing cartoonish Halloween music and ghost sounds. However, despite being more inviting than the last street, there seemed to be less places for you four to hide when pulling your pranks. It may be too risky.

The final street you saw was Haunted Road. This street was set in a much more wooded area than the other two. Instead of having houses incredibly close to one another like your average suburb, the houses were spread apart from each other and had fewer decorations. These houses seemed very stripped back and only had a small slew of skimpy decorations to even insinuate that they were celebrating Halloween. The houses too, although large and extravagant, seemed a bit strange, having old Victorian designs.

You also noticed there was a large park straight down Maple Street that was teeming with activity. There seemed to be a large Halloween party going on in the park. That could be a cool place to stop by too. In a large crowd you could pull some pranks on the individual townspeople and then easily slip away into the crowd. Plus, they won’t know what you really look like since all four of your are dressed up. You turn back to your friends, “So, what are we thinking guys/b}?”
15.title: A Time For Treats & A Time For Mischief

info.brief_description: You're out trick or treating. However, it turns out they're getting treats.
info.description:
You play as either a Trick or Treater, or as someone that has to watch over their sibling while they trick or treat. However, on a rumor, you end up heading to a weird neighborhood where "everyone is always dressed up like animals." However, upon reaching the neighborhood, the gates lock behind you. Furthermore, you learn those "costumes" aren't costumes! Animal people are residing here, and they are very hungry. And some... just want Treaters for who knows what. Worse yet, some legends say that the neighborhood only shows itself on Halloween night. At the stroke of midnight, it vanishes to whatever ether it came from. Can you escape the clutches of...

...Vampyre Lane?

Rules:
1) The protagonists can't be willing in the acts of the predators
2) Make sure the path to victory isn't over too soon. This is an adventure, you need to face hardship to escape. And no, you can't just climb the walls, there's barbed wire on the top.
3) No scat or watersports
4) Limit the gore
